Original:
Now that the statue is slowed down, you can try to insert the key to see if it might help defeat this menace.

Inserting the key requires you to attempt an DC 20 Athletics Skill Check to grapple the statue. Roll [[/r 1d20+7 #Athletics]]. If your result is equal to or greater than the DC to grapple the statue, it falls to the ground, deactivated.

If you succeed, you defeat the statue! Go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.HEr7Q5hCU4sUu9vG]{#06}.

If you fail, continue the fight. Return to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Eds15d6ZIMNit3Ke]{#19}.
Translation:
现在雕像的速度慢了下来，你可以尝试插入钥匙，看看这是否能有助于击败这个威胁。

插入钥匙需要你尝试一次 DC 20 的运动 技能 检定 来擒拿雕像。投掷 [[/r 1d20+7 #Athletics]]。如果你的结果等于或大于擒拿雕像的 DC，它就会倒在地上并停止运作。

如果你成功，你就击败了雕像！转到条目 @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.HEr7Q5hCU4sUu9vG]{#06}。

如果你失败，继续战斗。回到条目 @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Eds15d6ZIMNit3Ke]{#19}。

Involved Terms: Pirate King's Plunder->海贼王的财宝 | adventure->冒险 | player->玩家
Original:
Pirate King's Plunder is a simple adventure which requires no GM and can be completed by a single player.

In Pirate King's Plunder, you won't advance through the story by reading the journals in chronological order. Instead, at the end of each entry, you'll be presented with a set of choices. The decisions you make will lead you to different entries, which you can follow simply by clicking through the linked journal entries. For convenience, we have included a helpful journal entry to keep track of your notes and allow you to conveniently roll dice for your attacks and statistics.
Translation:
《海贼王的财宝》是一场简单的冒险，不需要GM，单名玩家即可完成。

在海贼王的财宝中，你不需要通过按时间顺序阅读日志来推进故事。相反，在每个条目的末尾，你将面临一系列选择。你所做的决定将引导你进入不同的条目，你只需点击链接的日志条目即可继续。为了方便起见，我们提供了一个实用的日志条目，用于记录笔记，并让你能方便地为攻击和各项数值掷骰。

Involved Terms: Creating Your Hero->创建你的角色 | adventure->冒险 | adventure->冒险 | character->角色 | treasure->宝藏 | treasure->宝藏 | coins->钱币
Original:
You returned to town safely and collect your reward for killing the wolf—10 gold!

But did you collect all of this adventure's treasure? Besides the reward, you can find coins and treasure worth 40 more gold during this adventure. Remember that 10 copper is equal to 1 silver and 10 silver is equal to 1 gold.

If you want to try again, you can return to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.dHOsZe4eRCxxK9Gb]{#01} and start over from the beginning.

You might also want to go straight to building your own character for future adventures. If so, go to @JournalEntry[KIpNnMtah73eyPC8]{Creating Your Hero} to begin the journey.
Translation:
你安全地回到了镇上，并领取了杀狼的奖励——10金币！

但你收集了这次冒险中的所有宝藏吗？除了奖励之外，你还可以在这次冒险中找到价值另外40金币的钱币和宝藏。记住，10铜币等于1银币，10银币等于1金币。

如果你想再次尝试，可以回到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.dHOsZe4eRCxxK9Gb]{#01}，从头开始。

你可能也想直接为未来的冒险创建你自己的角色。如果是这样，请前往@JournalEntry[KIpNnMtah73eyPC8]{创建你的角色}开始旅程。

Floor 1 Exploration Ambience->第一层探索环境音

Original:
Looking around, you notice a narrow crack in the wall, just above the curtain of moss. Water seems to be dripping out from the crack, and it looks wide enough that you might be able to squeeze inside. What do you do?

If you ignore the crack and turn to head down the passageway, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Aj3k03uAUj6kb0OV]{#10}.

If you crawl into the crack, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.h6jHD9J3VD3Auxo1]{#12}.
Translation:
环顾四周，你注意到墙上有一道狭窄的裂缝，就在那帘苔藓上方。水似乎正从裂缝中滴出，它看上去足够宽，也许可以让你挤进去。你要怎么做？

如果你无视这道裂缝，转身沿着通道走下去，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Aj3k03uAUj6kb0OV]。

如果你爬进裂缝，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.h6jHD9J3VD3Auxo1]。

Creating Your Hero->创建你的角色 | adventure->冒险 | character->角色
Original:
Your vision grows dark as life leaves your body. In your final moments, you can’t help but think that this is not how stories should end. Maybe the next hero will fare better in this deadly place...

Although you have died, there are still adventures to be had. You can start this adventure over by returning to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.dHOsZe4eRCxxK9Gb]{#01}. You are restored to full Hit Points, but so are all of the foes that you have faced. You must explore and face whatever dangers await you all over again.

Alternatively, you can start making your own character to play in adventures with others. Go to @JournalEntry[KIpNnMtah73eyPC8]{Creating Your Hero} to begin designing your very own hero!
Translation:
随着生命流逝，你的视线变得昏暗。在最后的时刻，你忍不住心想，故事不该就这样结束。也许下一位英雄能在这个致命的地方表现得更好……

虽然你已经牺牲，但仍有冒险在等着你。你可以通过回到条目 @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.dHOsZe4eRCxxK9Gb]{#01} 来重新开始这段 冒险。你的生命值将恢复满，但你面对过的所有敌人也同样如此。你必须重新探索并面对再次等待着你的一切危险。

或者，你可以开始创建自己的 角色 来与其他玩家一起进行冒险。前往 @JournalEntry[KIpNnMtah73eyPC8]{创建你的角色} 开始设计你专属的英雄吧！

Translation: 狗头人 首领佐尔格兰

Involved Terms: falling->坠落 | bonus->加值 | check->检定 | check->检定 | check->检定 | check->检定 | check->检定 | check->检定 | skill->技能 | skill->技能 | skill->技能 | skill->技能 | skill->技能 | skill->技能 | skill->技能 | rest->休息 | time->时代
Original:
In the center of the river is a pillar of stone that looks like it’s been submerged for a long time. You might be able to use it as a stepping-stone to jump across the river. However, you could also try to swim across.

Getting to the other side of the river requires a Skill Check. To attempt a skill check, roll a d20 and add the bonus associated with the skill you’re trying to use. If the result is equal to or greater than the DC of the task, you succeed! In this case, you can use Athletics to either jump across or swim across.

Your Athletics skill check: [[/r 1d20+7 #Athletics]]

Jump (DC 10)

If you try to jump across, you must succeed at two DC10 Athletics skill checks in a row (one to jump to the pillar and another to jump to the other side). If you fail either check, you fall in and must swim the rest of the way to the other side.

Swim (DC 15)

If you try to swim across, you must succeed at two DC15 Athletics skill checks. But if you succeeded at the check to jump to the pillar before falling in the water, you only need to succeed at one Athletics check to swim across, since you were already halfway.

These checks could be dangerous. If you're in the water and fail too many Athletics checks to swim, you get swept downstream. Since the river leads deep underground, through long tunnels without air, you'll drown if you fail a total of three Athletics skill checks before you succeed and get out of the water.

If you fail three Athletics checks, you are dragged into the underground river and beat against the rocks. Go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]{#17}.

If you make it to the other side, you can make your way down the stairs. Go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.DKDZReQDxqTz7sgu]{#03}.

If you instead decide to head back the way you came and try the other passage, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.zt9iBaumtu3CAHrD]{#15}.
Translation:
在河流中心有一根石柱，看起来已经被淹没了很长一段 时代。你也许可以用它作为跳过河流的垫脚石。不过，你也可以尝试游过去。

到达河流的另一侧需要进行一次 技能 检定。要尝试 技能 检定，请掷一个 d20 并加上与你尝试使用的 技能 相关的 加值。如果结果等于或大于该任务的 DC，你就成功了！在这种情况下，你可以使用运动（Athletics）来跳过去或游过去。

你的运动 技能 检定：[[/r 1d20+7 #Athletics]]

跳跃 (DC 10)

如果你尝试跳过去，你必须连续成功通过两次 DC 10 的运动 技能 检定（一次跳到石柱上，另一次跳到对岸）。如果你在任意一次 检定 中失败，你就会掉进水里，并且必须游完 休息 的路程到达对岸。

游泳 (DC 15)

如果你尝试游过去，你必须成功通过两次 DC 15 的运动 技能 检定。但如果你在 坠落 入水之前已经成功通过了跳到石柱上的 检定，你只需要成功通过一次运动 检定 即可游到对岸，因为你已经走了一半了。

这些检定可能很危险。如果你在水里且在游泳的运动检定中失败太多次，你就会被冲到下游。由于这条河流向地下深处，穿过没有空气的长长隧道，如果你在成功脱离水面之前总共失败了三次运动 技能 检定，你就会淹死。

如果你失败了三次运动检定，你会被拖入地下河并撞在岩石上。转到条目 @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]{#17}。

如果你到达了对岸，你可以顺着楼梯往下走。转到条目 @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.DKDZReQDxqTz7sgu]{#03}。

如果你决定原路返回并尝试另一条通道，转到条目 @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.zt9iBaumtu3CAHrD]{#15}。

Original: It almost sounds as if a rat just exploded out of a glass orb full of fire.
Translation: 听起来简直就像是一只老鼠刚从一个装满火焰的玻璃球中爆裂而出。

Original: "Menace under Otari" is designed to teach new Game Masters and players how to play Pathfinder using Foundry VTT. Each section of the adventure will teach new concepts and introduce features of the program, adding more and more to the game. Meanwhile, the other players each have an entire hero to roleplay as, learning how to use their abilities and how to succeed in the dangerous world that they find themselves exploring.
Translation: “奥塔里地底的威胁”旨在教导新的游戏主持人与玩家如何使用 Foundry VTT 游玩 Pathfinder。冒险的每个部分都将教授新的概念并介绍该程序的功能，为游戏增添越来越多的内容。与此同时，其他玩家将各自扮演一位完整的英雄，学习如何使用他们的能力，以及如何在他们所探索的危险世界中取得成功。

Involved Terms: damage->伤害 | damage->伤害 | damage->伤害 | damage->伤害 | time->时代
Original:
Using your blade, you begin to hack away at the icicle, but the first time you strike it, a wave of powerful, magical cold washes up your arm.

You take 1 damage. It looks like if you want to destroy the icicle, you’ll need to hit it at least three more times, taking another 3 damage.

If you decide to destroy the icicle with your sword, take 3 more damage and go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.B3hPHccbWsEhVvGj]{#02}.

If the damage reduces you to 0 Hit Points, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]{#17}.

If you decide to leave the icicle alone and jump down the chute, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.qcI1yZVH5QBDbpaj]{#23}.

If you instead decide to head back the way you came and try the other passage, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Op9v0801zCNxtVMJ]{#05}.
Translation:
你挥动剑刃，开始劈砍冰柱，但当你第一次 次 击中它时，一股强大的魔法寒流涌上你的手臂。

你受到 1 点 伤害。看起来如果你想摧毁冰柱，你至少还需要再击中它三次，并再受到 3 点 伤害。

如果你决定用剑摧毁冰柱，再受到 3 点 伤害 并转到条目 @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.B3hPHccbWsEhVvGj]{#02}。

如果 伤害 使你的生命值降至 0，转到条目 @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]{#17}。

如果你决定不管冰柱并跳下滑道，转到条目 @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.qcI1yZVH5QBDbpaj]{#23}。

如果你决定原路返回并尝试另一条通道，转到条目 @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Op9v0801zCNxtVMJ]{#05}。

Original:
In Pirate King's Plunder, you won't advance through the story by reading the journals in chronological order. Instead, at the end of each entry, you'll be presented with a set of choices. The decisions you make will lead you to different entries, which you can follow simply by clicking on the inline link.

Player Resources

The @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu]{Adventure Steps} journal contains every step of the adventure, and you'll navigate through it by making choices by clicking on the options at the end of each entry.

You can use the @UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.IrDInT1GRf8tKGyg]{Scratch Paper} page to help you keep track of actions you perform and items you pick up along the way.

Some of the adventure steps may require you to deal with a threat before you can progress. Generally, the description will tell you how to resolve the situation. If you find yourself in combat, the @UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.KcImx6Pq6vjKeJm5]{Combat Reference} page has a summary of the relevant rules.

When you're ready, advance to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.dHOsZe4eRCxxK9Gb]{#01} !
Translation:
在海贼王的财宝中，你不需要按照时间顺序阅读日志来推进故事。相反，在每个条目的结尾，你将面对一组选择。你所做的决定将引导你前往不同的条目，你只需点击文中链接即可跟随。

玩家资源

@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu]{冒险步骤}日志包含了冒险的每一步，你可以通过在每个条目的末尾点击选项来进行选择并跳转。

你可以使用 @UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.IrDInT1GRf8tKGyg]{草稿纸}页面来帮助你记录你执行的动作以及沿途拾取的物品。

某些冒险步骤可能需要你先处理掉威胁才能继续前进。通常情况下，描述会告诉你如何解决该情况。如果你发现自己进入了战斗，@UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.KcImx6Pq6vjKeJm5]{战斗参考}页面提供了相关规则的摘要。

当你准备好时，请前往条目 @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.dHOsZe4eRCxxK9Gb]{#01}！

Original:
It can’t be a coincidence that you found a key in the chamber above. Maybe it will help you defeat the statue, but you’re going to have to slow it down first.

You are now in combat with the pirate statue. To start this combat, you and the statue must start by rolling Initiative to determine who gets to act first. This is a Perception check that both of you attempt. The one who gets a higher result acts first in the combat (if you tie, the Statue goes first).

Your Perception check is [[/r 1d20+4 #Your Perception]].

The pirate statue’s Perception check is [[/r 1d20+0 #Pirate's Perception]].

Roll for both of you to determine who goes first. If you go first, you must spend 1 action to move next to the statue before making any attacks. The statue is much slower, so if it goes first, it must spend 2 actions to move up to you before attacking.

During combat, you can use the actions below. At the start of any of your turns, before using any actions, you can decide to flee the combat, leaving through a small crevice in the back of the chamber. If you do this, go to @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.6wxOV8Kjh8dDiGuY]{#04}.

1 Strike with Your Shortsword

See @UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.IrDInT1GRf8tKGyg]{Scratch Paper} for your Shortsword's statistics.

1 Move

You can move up to or away from the statue. If you move up to it, you can attack with your remaining actions. If you move away, the statue must spend 2 of its actions on its turn to move up to you before attacking.

2 Try the Key

If the statue has fewer than 10 Hit Points left, you can try to insert the key to deactivate it. This uses 2 actions (the symbol here represents two actions). If you try this, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.CFAahkSt8huRR8RU]{#22}.

Pirate Statue

AC: 18

Hit Points: 20

1 Strike with Saber

The statue uses all of its actions to attack if possible.

First attack: [[/r 1d20+9 #Strike with Saber 1]]

Second attack: [[/r 1d20+4 #Strike with Saber 2]]

Third attack: [[/r 1d20-1 #Strike with Saber 3]]

Damage: [[/r 1d8+2 #Pirate's Damage]]

2 Move

The statue moves toward you. This uses 2 actions (the symbol here represents 2 actions).

 

If you defeat the statue, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.HEr7Q5hCU4sUu9vG]{#06}.

If the statue defeats you, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]{#17}.
Translation:
你在上面的房间里找到了一把钥匙，这绝非巧合。也许它能帮你击败雕像，但你得先让它慢下来。

你现在正与海盗雕像进行战斗。要开始这场战斗，你和雕像必须先掷骰先攻来决定谁先行动。这是一次你们双方都要尝试的察觉检定。结果更高的一方在战斗中先行动（如果平局，则雕像先行动）。

你的察觉检定是 [[/r 1d20+4 #Your Perception]]。

海盗雕像的察觉检定是 [[/r 1d20+0 #Pirate's Perception]]。

为你们双方掷骰以决定谁先行动。如果你先行动，在进行任何攻击前，你必须花费1动作移动到雕像旁边。雕像要慢得多，所以如果它先行动，在攻击前它必须花费2动作移动到你身边。

在战斗中，你可以使用下方的动作。在你任何回合开始时，在使用任何动作之前，你可以选择逃离战斗，从房间后方的一个小裂缝离开。如果你这样做，转到 @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.6wxOV8Kjh8dDiGuY]{#04}。

1 使用你的短剑打击

关于短剑的统计数据，请参见 @UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.IrDInT1GRf8tKGyg]{草稿纸}。

1 移动

你可以移动靠近或远离雕像。如果你移动靠近它，你可以用剩余的动作进行攻击。如果你移动远离，雕像必须在它的回合中花费2个动作移动到你身边才能进行攻击。

2 尝试使用钥匙

如果雕像剩余的生命值少于10点，你可以尝试插入钥匙来使其停机。这需要消耗2个动作（这里的符号代表两个动作）。如果你尝试这样做，转到条目 @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.CFAahkSt8huRR8RU]{#22}。

海盗雕像

AC: 18

生命值: 20

1 用弯刀打击

如果可能，雕像会使用其所有的动作进行攻击。

第一次攻击： [[/r 1d20+9 #Strike with Saber 1]]

第二次攻击： [[/r 1d20+4 #Strike with Saber 2]]

第三次攻击： [[/r 1d20-1 #Strike with Saber 3]]

伤害： [[/r 1d8+2 #Pirate's Damage]]

2 移动

雕像向你移动。这需要消耗2个动作（这里的符号代表2个动作）。

 

如果你击败了雕像，转到条目 @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.HEr7Q5hCU4sUu9vG]{#06}。

如果雕像击败了你，转到条目 @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]{#17}。

Combat Reference->战斗参考 | Scratch Paper->草稿纸 | Scratch Paper->草稿纸 | actions->动作 | actions->动作 | attack->攻击 | attack->攻击 | attack->攻击 | attack->攻击 | turn->回合 | turn->回合 | turn->回合
Original:
Noticing the tracks leading to the cave, you hide in the nearby underbrush, hoping to ambush whatever foul beast lives here. After just a few minutes, you hear the sounds of something approaching, and the scent of wet fur hangs heavy in the air.

Emerging from the bushes is a lean, mangy wolf carrying the body of a dead chicken in its maw. It appears to be returning home after its most recent hunt. Clearly, this is the beast that's been preying upon the farmers' animals. You wait until it is near then draw your shortsword and spring out to attack!

You are now in combat with a wolf! You know that this feral beast cannot be tamed and must be slain to keep the farmers' livestock safe. 

Read the @UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.KcImx6Pq6vjKeJm5]{Combat Reference} for the rules on combat. 

Your AC, HP, and attacks are listed on your @UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.IrDInT1GRf8tKGyg]{Scratch Paper}.

On your turn, you can use the following actions.

1 Strike with Your Shortsword

See @UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.IrDInT1GRf8tKGyg]{Scratch Paper} for your Shortsword's statistics.

1 Hide in the Bushes

Increase your AC to 20 until the start of your next turn.

Remember that you go first. If you find that the wolf is hitting you too much, you should remember to hide with your third action to make it harder for the wolf to hit you. This process continues until you or the wolf is reduced to 0 HP.

Wolf

Wolf’s AC: 14

Wolf’s Hit Points: 15

1 Bite

On the wolf's turn, it attacks you three times, using all of its actions.

First attack: [[/r 1d20+5 #Wolf Attack 1]]

Second attack: [[/r 1d20 #Wolf Attack 2]]

Third attack: [[/r 1d20-5 #Wolf Attack 3]]

Damage: [[/r 1d6+2 #Wolf Damage]]

 

If you defeat the wolf, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.XJfSyziljE34cQEx]{#07}.

If the wolf defeats you, go to Entry@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]{#17} .
Translation:
注意到通向洞窟的足迹，你躲在附近的灌木丛中，希望能伏击住生活在这里的任何邪恶野兽。仅仅几分钟后，你听到了有什么东西靠近的声音，空气中弥漫着浓重的湿皮毛气味。

从灌木丛中走出来的是一匹消瘦且肮脏的狼，嘴里叼着一只死鸡。它似乎是在最近一次狩猎后返回巢穴。显然，这就是那只一直在捕食农民牲畜的野兽。你等到它靠近，然后拔出短剑，跃出发起攻击！

你现在正在和一匹狼战斗！你知道这头凶猛的野兽无法被驯服，必须将其杀死才能保证农民家畜的安全。

阅读@UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.KcImx6Pq6vjKeJm5]{战斗参考}以了解战斗规则。

你的AC、HP和攻击都列在你的@UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.IrDInT1GRf8tKGyg]{草稿纸}上。

在你的回合，你可以使用以下动作：

1 使用你的短剑进行打击

查看@UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.IrDInT1GRf8tKGyg]{草稿纸}以了解你短剑的数值。

1 躲在灌木丛中

将你的AC增加至20，直到你的下回合开始。

记住，你先行动。如果你发现狼命中你太频繁，你应该记得用第三个动作躲起来，让狼更难命中你。这个过程将持续到你或狼的HP减至0为止。

狼 Wolf

狼的AC：14

狼的生命值：15

1 啃咬 Bite

在狼的回合，它会使用其所有动作来攻击你3次。

第一次攻击：[[/r 1d20+5 #Wolf Attack 1]]

第二次攻击：[[/r 1d20 #Wolf Attack 2]]

第三次攻击：[[/r 1d20-5 #Wolf Attack 3]]

伤害：[[/r 1d6+2 #Wolf Damage]]

如果你击败了狼，请转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.XJfSyziljE34cQEx]{#07}。

如果狼击败了你，请转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]{#17}。

Involved Terms: Pathfinder Beginner Box->Pathfinder新手包 | Pirate King's Plunder->海贼王的财宝 | Menace Under Otari->奥塔里地下的威胁 | adventure->冒险 | access->许可 | Heroes->英雄
Original:
The Pathfinder Beginner Box, in its print form, simplifies many of the rules of the Pathfinder system in the interest of making it easier to get started for new users.

However, the Pathfinder Second Edition game system for Foundry Virtual Tabletop automates many game mechanics in the interest of streamlining gameplay activities for newcomers and veterans alike.

When converting this content, we realised that using the Beginner Box rules would, paradoxically, create a more complicated play experience for new users, as they would find that the system was applying rules that they hadn't heard of. Conversely, we also felt that simplification to the rules was not as necessary when the system's automation was able to supplant some of the nitty-gritty minutia of running the game.

In order to provide the best possible gameplay for Game Masters as well as players, we decided that we would attempt to integrate with the Pathfinder Second Edition system and, where necessary, make revisions to the original text of the Beginner Box in order to create a cohesive and unified experience. As such, the contents of the journal entries are not a one-to-one copy from the rules text outlined in the Game Master's Guide or Heroes Handbook from the PDF or Printed copy of the Beginner box. If you would prefer to use the Beginner Box rules as they are presented in the original source material, the purchase of this product also provides access to PDF copies of those texts.

The adventure text for Menace Under Otari and Pirate King's Plunder remain unchanged, except for places which instruct users on how to use the Pathfinder Second Edition game system for Foundry VTT.
Translation:
Pathfinder新手包的实体版本简化了许多Pathfinder系统的规则，旨在让新用户更容易上手。

然而，Foundry虚拟桌面（Foundry VTT）的Pathfinder第二版游戏系统自动化了许多游戏机制，旨在为新手和老手简化游戏流程。

在转换这些内容时，我们意识到，使用新手包规则反而会为新用户带来更复杂的游戏体验，因为他们会发现系统正在应用他们从未听说过的规则。相反，我们也认为，当系统的自动化能够取代运行游戏时的一些繁琐细节时，规则的简化就不那么必要了。

为了给游戏主持人（GM）和玩家提供最佳的游戏体验， we decided that we would attempt to integrate with the Pathfinder Second Edition system and, where necessary, make revisions to the original text of the Beginner Box in order to create a cohesive and unified experience. As such, the contents of the journal entries are not a one-to-one copy from the rules text outlined in the Game Master's Guide or 英雄 Handbook from the PDF or Printed copy of the Beginner box. If you would prefer to use the Beginner Box rules as they are presented in the original source material, the purchase of this product also provides 许可 to PDF copies of those texts.

冒险文本奥塔里地下的威胁和海贼王的财宝保持不变，除非是指导用户如何使用Foundry VTT的Pathfinder第二版游戏系统的部分。

Involved Terms: circumstance penalty->环境减值 | circumstance bonus->环境加值 | basic action->基础动作 | initiative->先攻 | character->角色 | character->角色 | character->角色 | actions->动作 | failure->失败 | success->成功 | check->检定 | skill->技能
Original:
As the GM, you're responsible for resolving any questions or disputes about the rules. Remember that keeping your game moving is more important than being 100% correct. Looking up rules at the table can slow the game down, so in many cases, it's better to make your best guess rather than scour the book for the exact rule. To make calls on the fly, use the following guidelines.

• If you don't know how long a quick task takes, go with 1 action, or 2 actions if a character shouldn't be able to perform it three times per round.

• If you're not sure what action a task uses, look for the most similar basic action.

• When two sides are opposed, have one roll against the other's DC. Don't have both sides roll (initiative is the exception to this rule). The character who should roll is the one acting, except in the case of saving throws.

• If something a character does raises or lowers the chances of success, grant a +1 circumstance bonus or a -1 circumstance penalty.

• If you don't know what check to use for something a hero is attempting, pick the most appropriate skill.

• When a hero accomplishes something noteworthy that doesn't have already give XP, award them XP for a minor or moderate accomplishment (10 to 30 XP).

• When the heroes fail at a task, look for a way they might fail forward, meaning the story moves forward with a negative consequence rather than the failure halting progress entirely.
Translation:
作为 GM，你负责解决任何关于规则的疑问或争议。请记住，保持游戏进行比 100% 正确更重要。在桌面上查阅规则会拖慢游戏进度，因此在许多情况下，与其翻遍书本寻找确切规则，不如做出你最好的猜测。要即兴做出裁决，请参考以下准则。

• 如果你不知道一项快速任务需要多长时间，请设定为 1 个动作，或者如果一个 角色 不应该能每轮执行三次该任务，则设定为 2 个 动作。

• 如果你不确定一项任务使用什么动作，请寻找最相似的 基础动作。

• 当双方对抗时，让一方针对另一方的 DC 进行投骰。不要让双方都投骰（先攻 是此规则的例外）。除了豁免投骰的情况外，应该投骰的 角色 是采取行动的那一方。

• 如果一个 角色 所做的事情提高或降低了 成功 的几率，请给予 +1 环境加值 或 -1 环境减值。

• 如果你不知道英雄尝试的某件事该使用什么 检定，请选择最合适的 技能。

• 当英雄完成了一些值得注意但尚未提供经验值（XP）的事情时，根据次要或中等成就奖励他们经验值（10 到 30 XP）。

• 当英雄们在任务中失败时，寻找一种让他们“失败推进（fail forward）”的方法，这意味着故事会伴随着负面后果继续推进，而不是因为 失败 而导致进度完全停滞。

root.entries.Menace Under Otari.journals.Creating Your Hero.pages.Pregenerated Heroes.name

Involved Terms: initiative->先攻 | initiative->先攻 | adventure->冒险 | adventure->冒险 | encounter->遭遇 | encounter->遭遇 | encounter->遭遇 | encounter->遭遇 | treasure->宝藏 | ability->能力 | Heroes->英雄 | reach->触及 | reach->触及 | Speed->速度 | spell->法术 | item->物品
Original:
An encounter typically ends when all the creatures on one side are killed or knocked unconscious. Once this happens, you can stop acting in initiative order—unless any heroes are dying or in some other situation where every moment matters for their survival.

  • Surrender: One side might surrender when almost all its members are defeated or if spells or skills thoroughly demoralize them. Once there’s a surrender, come out of initiative order and have the heroes enter into a short negotiation to see whether the winners show mercy.

  • Escape: Having enemies flee can cause problems. Heroes often want to pursue foes that flee because they think an enemy might return as a threat later on. If you run this round-by-round, your game will get boring quickly! Instead, ask anyone who wants to pursue their fleeing enemy how they pursue. If they use an ability or spell that seems really helpful, and if their Speed isn’t much slower than the escaping enemy, they catch the enemy. If not, the enemy escapes for now unless it’s much slower than the heroes.

If the heroes decide to flee, it’s usually best to let them do so. Pick a particular location on the map and allow them to escape once they all reach it.

Bypassed Encounters

What happens if you plan a fight or challenge and the heroes find a way to avoid it entirely? This could leave them behind on XP or cause them to miss important information or treasure.

In the case of XP, the guidelines are simple: If the heroes avoided the challenge with smart thinking and planning, award them the normal XP they would have received! If they did something that was more of a lucky break, like finding a secret passage past the fight, instead award them XP for a minor or moderate accomplishment.

If information or items get skipped, look for another reasonable place elsewhere in the adventure to place the information or item. If it makes sense, move the original encounter to another part of the adventure and give the heroes a major advantage when they reach that encounter since they bypassed the original encounter.
Translation:
一场遭遇通常在其中一方的所有生物都被杀死或击昏时结束。一旦发生这种情况，你就可以停止按先攻顺序行动——除非有英雄正在垂死，或者处于其他每一刻都关乎生存的情况下。

  • 投降：当一方几乎所有成员都被击败，或者法术或技能彻底瓦解了他们的士气时，他们可能会投降。一旦有人投降，就退出先攻顺序，让英雄们进入简短的交涉，看看胜者是否会展现仁慈。

  • 逃跑：让敌人逃跑可能会引发问题。英雄通常想要追击逃跑的敌人，因为他们认为敌人以后可能会作为威胁再次出现。如果你按轮次进行，你的游戏很快就会变得无聊！相反，询问任何想要追击逃跑敌人的玩家他们如何追击。如果他们使用了看起来非常有帮助的能力或法术，且他们的速度不比逃跑的敌人慢太多，他们就能追上敌人。否则，除非敌人比英雄慢得多，否则敌人暂时逃脱。

如果英雄们决定逃跑，通常最好让他们这样做。在地图上选择一个特定位置，并允许他们在全部触及该位置后逃脱。

绕过的遭遇

如果你计划了一场战斗或挑战，而英雄们找到了完全避开它的方法，会发生什么？这可能会导致他们的经验值（XP）落后，或者导致他们错过重要的信息或宝藏。

就经验值而言，指导原则很简单：如果英雄们通过聪明的思考和规划避开了挑战，就奖励他们原本会获得的正常经验值！如果他们做的事情更多是出于运气，比如发现了一条绕过战斗的秘密通道，则改为奖励他们一项次要或中等成就的经验值。

如果错过了信息或物品，请在冒险的其他地方寻找另一个合理的位置来放置这些信息或物品。如果合理的话，将原本的遭遇移动到冒险的另一部分，并在英雄们触及该遭遇时给予他们重大优势，因为他们绕过了原本的遭遇。

Involved Terms: simple DCs->基础DC | character->角色 | character->角色 | Creatures->生物 | creature->生物 | creature->生物 | creature->生物 | terrain->地形 | weather->天气 | target->目标 | Skills->技能 | Skills->技能 | check->检定 | check->检定 | check->检定 | check->检定 | check->检定 | level->等级 | level->等级 | level->等级 | level->等级 | level->等级 | level->等级 | level->等级 | level->等级 | magic->魔法 | magic->魔法 | spell->法术 | spell->法术 | item->物品 | Will->意志
Original:
Several parts of this book, most notably Skills, state that you as the GM set the DCs for certain checks or determine other parameters. Here are guidelines for the most common tasks, with Deception, Diplomacy, and Intimidation grouped together under “Social Skills.” Anything more difficult than what’s listed here uses the Master DC of 30. Remember that all of these are guidelines, and you can adjust them as necessary to suit the situation.

Balance (Acrobatics)

Use @UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{Simple DCs} based on what the character is trying to balance across.

• Untrained: (DC 10) tangled roots, uneven cobblestones

• Trained: (DC 15) wooden beam

• Expert: (DC 20) deep, loose gravel

Climb (Athletics)

Use @UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{Simple DCs} based on what the character is trying to climb up or across.

• Untrained: (DC 10) ladder, low-branched tree, steep slope

• Trained: (DC 15) rigging, rope, typical tree

• Expert: (DC 20) wall with small handholds and footholds

Decipher Writing

Base the DC on how complex and hard to understand the text is. A hero doesn’t need to roll to read a text that’s written in plain language.

• Trained: (DC 15) entry-level philosophy treatise

• Expert: (DC 20) complex code, such as a cipher

Gather Information (Diplomacy)

To set the DC to Gather Information, use a  @UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{Simple DC} representing the availability of information about the subject. Adjust the DC upward if the hero seeks in-depth information.

• Untrained: (DC 10) talk of the town

• Trained: (DC 15) common rumor

• Expert: (DC 20) obscure rumor, poorly guarded secret

Identify Magic or Learn a Spell

The DC to Identify Magic or Learn a Spell is the @UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-5:-level-based-dcs]{Level-Based DC} for the spell or item’s level.

Perform (Performance)

Consider the audience’s exposure to the arts when picking the @UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{Simple DC}. How easy are they to impress?

• Untrained: (DC 10) audience of commoners

• Trained: (DC 15) audience of artisans

• Expert: (DC 20) audience of merchants or minor nobles

Recall Knowledge

On most topics, you can use simple DCs for checks to Recall Knowledge. For a check about a specific creature, trap, or other subject with a level, use a  @UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-5:-level-based-dcs]{Level-Based DC}. You might adjust the difficulty down, maybe even drastically if the subject is famous.

• Untrained: (DC 10) name of a ruler, key noble, or major deity

• Trained: (DC 15) line of succession for a major noble family, core doctrines of a major deity

• Expert: (DC 20) genealogy of a minor noble, teachings of an ancient priest

Sometimes a hero might want to follow up on a check to Recall Knowledge by attempting another check to discover more information. This can sometimes work, but you should adjust the difficulty to be higher for each follow-up attempt. Once a hero has attempted an incredibly hard check or failed a check, further attempts are fruitless—the hero has recalled everything they know about the subject.

Information on using Recall Knowledge to identify monsters is in the @UUID[.ZVyi2AkmgpWOHvSq]{Creatures} handout.

Sense Direction (Survival)

Pick the most appropriate @UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{Simple DC} when someone uses Survival to Sense Direction.

• Untrained: (DC 10) determine a cardinal direction using the sun

• Trained: (DC 15) find an overgrown path in a forest

• Expert: (DC 20) navigate a hedge maze

Social Skills

When a hero uses Deception, Diplomacy, or Intimidation to influence or impress someone whose level or Will DC you don’t know, estimate the level of the creature and use that DC. A commoner’s level is usually 0 or 1. Don’t worry about being exact. It often makes sense to adjust the DC based on the target’s attitude, using one of the easy DC adjustments if the creature is more friendly or a hard DC adjustment if they dislike the hero. Remember that NPCs aren’t robots. If they’d be unlikely to do something, you can make the DC harder or even impossible!

Swim (Athletics)

Use @UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{Simple DCs} based on how turbulent the water is.

• Untrained: (DC 10) lake or other still water

• Trained: (DC 15) flowing water, like a river

• Expert: (DC 20) swiftly flowing river

Track (Survival)

Pick a @UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{Simple DC}. You can adjust the DC to Track based on weather, terrain, and other factors.

• Untrained: (DC 10) the path of a large army following a road

• Trained: (DC 15) relatively fresh tracks of a rampaging bear across the tundra

• Expert: (DC 20) a nimble panther’s tracks through a jungle, tracks obscured by rainfall
Translation:
本书的几个部分，最显著的是技能，说明了由你作为GM为某些检定设定DC或确定其他参数。以下是针对最常见任务的指南，其中欺骗、外交和威吓被归类在“社交技能”下。任何比此处列出的更困难的任务都使用大师DC 30。请记住，所有这些都是指南，你可以根据需要调整它们以适应情况。

平衡（特技）

根据角色试图平衡通过的对象，使用@UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{基础DC}。

• 未受训练：(DC 10) 纠缠的树根，不平整的鹅卵石

• 受训：(DC 15) 木梁

• 专家：(DC 20) 深且松散的碎石

攀爬（运动）

根据角色试图向上或横向攀爬的对象，使用@UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{基础DC}。

• 未受训练：(DC 10) 梯子，低矮分叉的树，陡坡

• 受训：(DC 15) 索具，绳索，典型的树木

• 专家：(DC 20) 带有微小手脚支点的墙壁

解读文字

根据文本的复杂程度和理解难度来设定DC。英雄不需要掷骰就能阅读用平实语言编写的文本。

• 受训：(DC 15) 入门级哲学论文

• 专家：(DC 20) 复杂的代码，例如密码

搜集信息（外交）

要设定搜集信息的DC，请使用代表该主题信息可用性的@UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{基础DC}。如果英雄寻求深入的信息，请向上调整DC。

• 未受训练：(DC 10) 街谈巷议

• 受训：(DC 15) 普通传闻

• 专家：(DC 20) 晦涩的传闻，保护不严的秘密

鉴定魔法或学习法术

鉴定魔法或学习法术的DC是该法术或物品等级对应的@UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-5:-level-based-dcs]{等级相关DC}。

表演（表演）

在选择@UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{基础DC}时，考虑观众对艺术的接触程度。他们有多容易被打动？

• 未受训练：(DC 10) 平民观众

• 受训：(DC 15) 工匠观众

• 专家：(DC 20) 商人或小贵族观众

回忆知识

对于大多数话题，你可以使用基础DC来进行回忆知识检定。对于关于特定生物、陷阱或其他具有等级的主题的检定，请使用@UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-5:-level-based-dcs]{等级相关DC}。如果该主题非常出名，你可能会向下调整难度，甚至大幅调整。

• 未受训练：(DC 10) 统治者、重要贵族或主要神祇的名字

• 受训：(DC 15) 主要贵族家族的继承顺序，主要神祇的核心教义

• 专家：(DC 20) 小贵族的家谱，古代祭司的教诲

有时英雄可能希望在回忆知识检定之后尝试另一次检定以发现更多信息。这有时可行，但你应该为每次后续尝试调高难度。一旦英雄尝试了极难的检定或在检定中失败，进一步的尝试都是徒劳的——英雄已经回想起了他们所知道的关于该主题的一切。

关于使用回忆知识鉴定怪物的信息在@UUID[.ZVyi2AkmgpWOHvSq]{生物}讲义中。

辨别方向（生存）

当有人使用生存来辨别方向时，选择最合适的@UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{基础DC}。

• 未受训练：(DC 10) 利用太阳确定基本方位

• 受训：(DC 15) 在森林中寻找杂草丛生的小径

• 专家：(DC 20) 在树篱迷宫中导航

社交技能

当英雄使用欺骗、外交或威吓来影响或打动一个你不知道其等级或意志 DC的人时，估算该生物的等级并使用该DC。平民的等级通常是0或1。不要担心是否精确。根据目标的态度调整DC通常是有意义的，如果生物更友好，则使用简单DC调整，如果他们不喜欢英雄，则使用困难DC调整。记住，NPC不是机器人。如果他们不太可能做某事，你可以让DC变得更难甚至不可能！

游泳（运动）

根据水流的湍急程度使用@UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{基础DC}。

• 未受训练：(DC 10) 湖泊或其他静水

• 受训：(DC 15) 流动的水，如河流

• 专家：(DC 20) 湍急的河流

追踪（生存）

选择一个@UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{基础DC}。你可以根据天气、地形和其他因素调整追踪的DC。

• 未受训练：(DC 10) 大军沿路行进的路径

• 受训：(DC 15) 狂暴的熊穿过苔原留下的相对较新的足迹

• 专家：(DC 20) 敏捷的豹子穿过丛林的足迹，或被雨水遮盖的足迹

Involved Terms: Creating Your Hero->创建你的角色
environment->环境 | adventure->冒险 | weather->天气 | weather->天气 | Hazards->危害
Original:
Bring out the players’ curiosity through memorable settings that include mysterious and fantastical locations for the heroes to visit! Exploring each location should be a treat in itself, not just a step the players must complete to get from one fight to the next. As you create a locale, picture it in your mind’s eye, and write down details you can include as you narrate the game. Describing decorations, natural landmarks, wildlife, peculiar smells, and even temperature changes makes a place feel more real.

Beyond monsters and loot, your locations can include challenges based on the environment, from weather conditions like blizzards to puzzles, traps, or other hazards. These challenges should suit your adventure’s location: walls of brambles in a castle ruin overrun with vegetation, pools of acid in a cursed swamp, or magical traps in the tomb of a paranoid wizard. Consult the handouts for @UUID[.AJZOnRliAzq7nbDM]{Environments}, @UUID[.mhP6TyghfJ6AE3ia]{Weather}, and @UUID[.f82BLxCvoOGIzQ7U]{Hazards} for inspiration.
Translation:
通过令人难忘的背景设定来激发玩家的好奇心，其中包括供英雄们造访的神秘且奇幻的地点！探索每个地点本身就应该是一种享受，而不仅仅是玩家为了从一场战斗进入下一场战斗而必须完成的步骤。当你创造一个地点时，在脑海中构思它的样子，并写下你在描述游戏时可以包含的细节。描述装饰物、自然地标、野生动物、独特的气味，甚至是温度的变化，都会让一个地方感觉更加真实。

除了怪物和战利品，你的地点还可以包含基于环境的挑战，从暴风雪等天气状况到谜题、陷阱或其他危害。这些挑战应该符合你冒险的地点：在植被丛生的城堡废墟中出现的荆棘墙，在受诅咒沼泽中的酸液池，或者是偏执法师陵墓中的魔法陷阱。查阅关于@UUID[.AJZOnRliAzq7nbDM]{环境}、@UUID[.mhP6TyghfJ6AE3ia]{天气}和@UUID[.f82BLxCvoOGIzQ7U]{危害}的讲义以获取灵感。

As the Game Master, it’s up to you to set the difficulty classes (DCs) for checks that don’t already say what the DC is. Most adventures include the most important DCs in them, but the players will improvise and try things the adventure writer didn’t think of! Always base the DC on how hard the task is, regardless of how good at it the heroes are. Sometimes the players will attempt something that’s really easy for them, and that’s okay!

If the DC is for something with a level, like a spell or item, see Level-Based DCs below.

Table 10-4: Simple DCs

You can select a simple DC from the table below by estimating which proficiency rank best matches the task (that rank isn't required to succeed at the task, just used for guidance).

• If pretty much anyone would have a decent chance, use the untrained DC.

• If anyone with some training has a solid chance, use the trained DC.

• If someone has to be highly skilled, use the expert DC.

• If this task is highly unlikely for a hero to be able to achieve, use the master DC.

You might decide a DC should differ from the baseline. For instance, maybe when the heroes reached a cliff, they climbed it with a DC of 15, but when they came back, it was raining. You could adjust the DC up to 17 because it's harder to climb in these conditions. Similarly, the rarity of a creature or item might influence the DC to recall knowledge about it.

Translation:
作为游戏管理者，由你来为那些没有注明难度等级（DC）的检定设定 DC。大多数冒险都会包含最重要的 DC，但玩家们会即兴发挥，尝试一些冒险作者没有想到的事情！始终根据任务的难度来设定 DC，无论英雄们对此有多擅长。有时玩家会尝试一些对他们来说非常容易的事情，这没关系！

如果 DC 是针对具有等级的事物，例如法术或物品，请参阅下方的基于等级的 DC。

表 10-4：简单 DC

你可以通过评估哪种熟练度等级最适合该任务，从下表中选择一个简单 DC（该等级并非成功完成任务所必需，仅用于指导）。

• 如果几乎任何人都有相当大的机会，请使用未入门 DC。

• 如果任何受过一定训练的人都有可靠的机会，请使用受训 DC。

• 如果某人必须技艺精湛，请使用专家 DC。

• 如果英雄极不可能完成这项任务，请使用大师 DC。

Involved Terms: downtime->休整模式 | downtime->休整模式 | downtime->休整模式 | downtime->休整模式 | Heroes->英雄 | level->等级 | level->等级 | magic->魔法 | gear->道具 | rest->休息 | rest->休息 | rest->休息 | time->时代 | time->时代 | time->时代
Original:
When the heroes return home or otherwise aren’t adventuring, they’re in downtime. This is their time to do everyday activities, such as buying gear. You might not have any downtime in your games at all! If the heroes do have some time off between adventures, just ask the players to spend a few minutes describing what their heroes do in that time. You probably won’t need to roleplay any scenes. Downtime is a bigger focus of the full Pathfinder game since the choices the heroes make carry across all 20 levels of play.

Two things heroes can likely do during downtime are shop for magic items and rest long enough to recover from ailments. A hero who does nothing but rest for a full 24-hour period recovers Hit Points equal to double their Constitution instead of the normal amount from an 8-hour rest. Heroes above 1st level multiply this amount by their level.
Translation:
当英雄们回到家乡或是不在冒险时，他们处于休整模式。这是他们进行日常活动的时间，例如购买装备。你的游戏中可能根本没有任何休整模式！如果英雄们在冒险之间确实有一些时间，只需让玩家花几分钟描述他们的英雄在那段时间里做了什么。你可能不需要进行任何场景的角色扮演。休整模式是完整版开拓者游戏的重点，因为英雄们所做的选择会贯穿全部 20 个等级的游戏过程。

英雄在休整模式期间可能做的两件事是购买魔法物品，以及进行足够长的休息以从疾病中恢复。一名除了休息以外什么都不做的英雄，在整整 24 小时后恢复的生命值等于其体质的两倍，而非通常 8 小时休息所恢复的数值。1 级以上的英雄将此数值乘以其等级。

Table 10-1: Encounter Budget

Choose a difficulty for your encounter. Remember— Severe encounters have a high chance of a player character being hurt, and Extreme encounters should be reserved for campaign-ending pivotal fights!

The "character adjustment" column tells you how much XP to add or remove from your budget for each character above or below the standard party size of four heroes.

Encounter BudgetDifficultyCharacter Adjustment
40 or lessTrivial10 or less
60Low15
80Moderate20
120Severe30
160Extreme40

Table 10-2: Creature XP and Role

Choose a number of creatures whose XP total adds up to your budget. Remember to use a good mix of levels! Creatures that are one or two levels above your players make for good bosses but can be frustrating to fight often. Creatures three or more levels above them are extremely deadly threats even by themselves!

If you'd like, you can also use hazards to add XP to your encounter. The XP value of a hazard depends on whether it's simple or complex.

表 10-1：遭遇预算

为你的遭遇选择一个难度。记住——严峻遭遇有很高几率导致玩家角色受伤，而极难遭遇应当留给那些关乎战役终结的关键战斗！

“角色调整值”一栏会告诉你，对于超出或少于标准四人英雄团队体型的每个角色，你应该从预算中增加或减少多少经验值（XP）。

Original:
The Beginner Box was designed for use with the following four iconic characters, any of which would be a great choice for new players or those who want to jump straight into the action:

You can find them under "Heroes" on the actors tab of the sidebar on the right hand side of your screen. 

To learn more about how to play the iconic characters, or to help you decide which one to play, you can read the descriptions of each class, which finishes with a summary of their backstory.

Other Characters

If you want to expand the choices at your table, any of the level 1 heroes from the Iconics compendium would serve well. However, some of them may feature more complicated classes or features than those included in the Beginner Box.

In addition, you can always make your own heroes from scratch. In that case, consult the @UUID[.RRxNZiD64dvvpWYt]{Character Creation} journal page. You'll need to provide your own tokens for these heroes, or choose from one of the several generic tokens included with this world. Your GM can find them inside of the module files, at:

pf2e-beginner-box/assets/portraits-heroes
Translation:
新手入门盒是为以下四位传奇角色设计的，对于新玩家或想要直接开始行动的玩家来说，其中任何一位都是极佳的选择：

你可以在屏幕右侧侧边栏的角色标签页下的“英雄”中找到他们。 

要了解更多关于如何扮演这些传奇角色的信息，或帮助你决定扮演哪一位，你可以阅读每个职业的描述，其末尾附有他们的背景故事总结。

其他角色

如果你想扩大桌上的选择范围，传奇角色（Iconics）典籍库中的任何等级 1英雄都很合适。然而，其中一些英雄的职业或特性可能比新手入门盒中包含的更为复杂。

此外，你随时可以从头开始创建自己的英雄。在这种情况下，请参考@UUID[.RRxNZiD64dvvpWYt]{创建角色}日志页面。你需要为这些英雄提供自己的棋子，或者从本世界包含的几个通用棋子中选择。你的 GM 可以在模组文件中找到它们，路径为：

pf2e-beginner-box/assets/portraits-heroes

Involved Terms: darkness->黑暗 | rounding->取整 | damage->伤害 | damage->伤害 | damage->伤害 | damage->伤害 | check->检定 | level->等级
Original:
Abandoning caution, you dive down the chute, heading into the freezing darkness!

The surface is slick and freezing cold, and you pick up quite a bit of speed as you descend deeper into the earth. Just as the chute begins to level out, you see a massive icicle up ahead, blocking most of the tunnel. At this speed, running into it is going to hurt!

You can try to avoid hitting the icicle and taking any serious harm by attempting a DC 17 Reflex saving throw. Roll [[/r 1d20+5 #Reflex]].

If your check result is less than the DC, you take [[/r 1d8 #Damage]] points of damage from running into the icicle. If you succeed, you take half damage (roll the d8 and divide the number rolled in half, rounding down). If your roll results in a 20, you critically succeed and avoid the icicle completely, taking no damage! Finally, if your roll results in a 1 or a 2, you critically fail the saving throw and take double damage (roll the d8 and double the result).

If you survive, the chute drops you into a large chamber. Go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.DKDZReQDxqTz7sgu]{#03}.

If hitting the icicle reduces you to 0 Hit Points or fewer, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]{#17}.
Translation:
不再谨慎，你冲下滑道，一头扎进冰冷的黑暗中！

滑道表面光滑且冰冷，随着你向地底深处坠落，你的速度变得相当快。就在滑道开始变得平缓时，你看到前方有一根巨大的冰柱，堵住了大部分通道。在这种速度下，撞上它会很疼！

你可以尝试进行一次 DC 17 的反射豁免检定，以试着避开冰柱并免受严重伤害。掷骰 [[/r 1d20+5 #Reflex]]。

如果你的检定结果小于 DC，你会因为撞上冰柱而受到 [[/r 1d8 #Damage]] 点伤害。如果你成功，你受到一半伤害（掷 d8 并将结果减半，向下取整）。如果你的掷骰结果为 20，你取得大成功并完全避开了冰柱，不受到伤害！最后，如果你的掷骰结果为 1 或 2，则你的豁免检定大失败，并受到双倍伤害（掷 d8 并将结果翻倍）。

如果你活了下来，滑道会将你送入一个巨大的房间。转到条目 @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.DKDZReQDxqTz7sgu]{#03}。

如果撞击冰柱使你的生命值降至 0 或更低，转到条目 @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]{#17}。

Original:
To build a combat encounter, first decide how the encounter fits into the adventure as a whole. Then, estimate how much of a threat you want the encounter to pose. An encounter has an XP budget. This is how much XP all the monsters in it are worth. This budget depends on how much of a threat the foes are.

The @UUID[.LhKbKh6JlJKFhwbO]{Encounter Budget} handout has all of the tables you'll need in one place— once you're familiar with the rules, you'll be able to use it to quickly build engaging and balanced encounters. If this is the first time you've built an encounter, though, the steps below will guide you through the process.

Step 1: Encounter Difficulty

Before we can choose the @UUID[.ZVyi2AkmgpWOHvSq]{Creatures} that will appear in our encounter, we'll need to decide how difficult we want the encounter to be. This will tell us our Encounter Budget. You can choose from the list below, or use Table 10-1 on the @UUID[.LhKbKh6JlJKFhwbO]{Encounter Budget} handout.

• Low-threat encounters (budget = 60 XP) use some of the party’s resources, but they aren’t that scary. It would be unlikely (or the result of very poor tactics) for the entire party to be seriously threatened.

• Moderate-threat encounters (budget = 80 XP) are a serious challenge to the heroes, though unlikely to overpower them completely. Heroes usually need to use sound tactics and manage their resources wisely.

• Severe-threat encounters (budget = 120 XP) are the hardest encounters most groups of heroes can consistently defeat. These encounters should be save for important moments in your story, such as confronting a final boss. Bad luck, poor tactics, or lack of resources due to prior encounters can easily turn a severe-threat encounter against the heroes, and a wise group keeps the option to disengage open.

You might warn the players when they enter a severe fight, especially if they’re new to Pathfinder. Their heroes likely can tell when they’re up against an enemy that looks really tough, even if the players aren’t sure yet!

Step 2: Spend Your Budget

Next, we can use our budget to choose creatures and hazards to populate our encounter. To do this, consult tables 10-3 and 10-4 on the @UUID[.LhKbKh6JlJKFhwbO]{Encounter Budget} handout.

The Pathfinder Second Edition system includes a huge number of creatures, which are available to you from the system compendiums. You can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pf2e-macros.s2sa8lo9dcIA6UGe]{Compendium Browser} to search the Bestiaries for creatures of the appropriate levels, with the option to filter for certain traits if you want to narrow your search.

Try to think about the location the encounter is happening, and choose creatures that might appear there or that can make good use of the terrain. The goal is to engage your players and get them to think tactically, while also making the world feel more real.

Once you've chosen the specific creatures that will constitute your encounter, make sure that you drag them out of the Compendium Browser and into your world. They'll appear in the Actors tab of your sidebar (the silhouette icon). If you'd like, you can also assign them a portrait and token here, although this is entirely optional.

Step 3: Run the Encounter!

That's right- that's all it took! Now that you know which creatures you have in mind, you're ready to run the encounter. The rules for how an encounter plays out are detailed in the @UUID[.hZz7TLxyIJpNZbHF]{Running Encounters} page.
Translation:
要构建一场战斗遭遇，首先要决定这场遭遇如何融入整个冒险。然后，评估你希望这场遭遇构成的威胁程度。一场遭遇拥有XP预算。这就是其中所有怪物所值的XP总额。该预算取决于敌人的威胁程度。

@UUID[.LhKbKh6JlJKFhwbO]{遭遇预算}讲义将你所需的所有表格集中在了一处——一旦你魔宠了这些规则，你就能用它快速构建出引人入胜且平衡的遭遇。不过，如果这是你第一时代构建遭遇，接下来的步骤将引导你完成整个过程。

第 1 步：遭遇难度

在选择出现在遭遇中的@UUID[.ZVyi2AkmgpWOHvSq]{生物}之前，我们需要决定这场遭遇的难度。这将告诉我们遭遇预算。你可以从下面的列表中选择，或者使用@UUID[.LhKbKh6JlJKFhwbO]{遭遇预算}讲义上的表 10-1。

• 低威胁遭遇（预算 = 60 XP）会消耗队伍的一些资源，但并不那么可怕。整个队伍不太可能（或者是战术非常糟糕的结果）受到严重威胁。

• 中等威胁遭遇（预算 = 80 XP）对英雄们来说是一个严峻的挑战，尽管不太可能完全压倒他们。英雄通常需要使用合理的战术并明智地管理他们的资源。

• 严重威胁遭遇（预算 = 120 XP）是大多数英雄团队能够稳定击败的最难遭遇。这些遭遇应该豁免给故事中的重要时刻，例如面对最终首领。运气不佳、战术不当或由于之前的遭遇导致资源匮乏，都很容易让一场严重威胁的遭遇回合英雄们，而明智的团队会保留撤退的选择。

当玩家进入一场严重威胁的战斗时，你或许可以提醒他们，尤其是如果他们是探路者（Pathfinder）的新手。他们的英雄很可能一眼就能看出眼前的敌人非常棘手，即使玩家们还不确定！

第 2 步：消耗你的预算

接下来，我们可以使用预算来选择生物和危害来填充我们的遭遇。为此，请参考@UUID[.LhKbKh6JlJKFhwbO]{遭遇预算}讲义上的表 10-3 和 10-4。

探路者第二版系统包含大量的生物，你可以从系统典籍（Compendiums）中获取。你可以使用@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pf2e-macros.s2sa8lo9dcIA6UGe]{典籍浏览器}在怪物图鉴（Bestiaries）中搜索相应等级的生物，还可以选择过滤特定特征以缩小搜索范围。

试着思考遭遇发生的地点，并选择可能出现在那里或能充分利用地形的生物。目标是吸引你的玩家并让他们进行战术思考，同时也让世界感觉更加真实。

一旦你选定了构成遭遇的具体生物，请确保将它们从典籍浏览器（Compendium Browser）拖入你的世界。它们将出现在侧边栏的生物（Actors）页签中（剪影图标）。如果你愿意，也可以在这里为它们分配头像和棋子（Token），尽管这完全是可选的。

第 3 步：开始遭遇！

没错——就这么简单！既然你已经确定了要使用的生物，就可以开始运行遭遇了。关于遭遇如何进行的详细规则请参见@UUID[.hZz7TLxyIJpNZbHF]{运行遭遇}页面。

Original:
When you’re in a tense fight and every individual action counts, you enter an encounter. Time is divided into rounds, each of which is 6 seconds of time in the game world. (Ten rounds is 1 minute.) Every round, each creature in that combat takes a turn in an established order called initiative. An encounter takes place following these four steps.

Step 1: Roll Initiative

When the encounter starts, the GM calls for initiative. Roll your Perception (unless you were Avoiding Notice in the lead-up to the battle, in which case you roll Stealth). The GM rolls initiative for anyone other than the heroes in the encounter. Unlike a typical check, where the result is compared to a DC, the results of initiative rolls are ranked from highest to lowest.

Step 2: Play a Round

The round starts with the creature who rolled the highest initiative taking their turn first. The process of taking a turn is described below.

Once the first creature has taken their turn, the one with the next highest initiative takes their turn, and so on. If initiative results are tied, enemies go before the heroes. If creatures on the same side tie, they choose what order to go the first time their initiative comes up. After that, everyone’s place in the initiative order doesn’t change for the rest of that encounter.

Once everyone has taken a turn, the round ends, and the next one begins.

Step 3: Begin the Next Round

Initiative is like a clock—after all combatants have taken their turns, you’ll start a new round. Go back to the highest initiative number and everyone takes another turn in the same order in the new round.

Step 4: End the Encounter

When everyone on one side is defeated, some sort of truce is reached, or another event or circumstance stops the combat, the encounter ends. You and the other participants no longer follow the initiative order, and the game returns to exploration.

At the end of an encounter, the GM may award Experience Points to the party, or you may find treasure to divvy up.

Taking Your Turn

When it reaches your initiative in combat, you get to take your turn! You can use your actions on your turn, and some special rules apply at the start and end of your turn. Here’s what you do during each part of your turn.

Start of Your Turn

• If you created an effect with a duration lasting a certain number of rounds, like many spells do, reduce the number of rounds remaining by 1. The effect ends if the duration is reduced to 0.

• If you’re dying, roll a recovery check (see @UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.SucJycHedcDPml60]{Hit Points, Healing, and Dying}).

• Lose the reaction from your previous turn, and regain your 3 actions and 1 reaction. You can’t “save up” unused actions or reactions from previous turns. If a condition or effect prevents you from using some, but not all, of your actions, you still regain the remaining actions. If a condition or effect prevents you from using all of your actions, you don’t regain any actions or your reaction.

Using Actions

• Now that you have your actions, it’s time to use them! You can perform your actions in any order you wish, but you have to complete one before beginning another. For example, you couldn’t Strike while in the middle of a Stride unless a special activity lets you. You can pick your actions from the basic actions available to all characters as well as any actions you get from your class, ancestry, equipment, or any other choices you made during character creation.

• Once you’re done spending actions, go to the end of your turn.

End of Your Turn

• Lose any of your 3 actions that remain. You keep your reaction if you didn’t use it on your turn; you lose it at the start of your next turn.

• If you are suffering from @UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.9H0Jrj0siUcpFC1s#persistent-damage]{Persistent Damage}, you take the damage at this time. After taking the damage, you can attempt the flat check to end the persistent damage.

• End any effects that last until the end of your turn.

• Resolve anything else specified to happen at the end of your turn.

• Your turn is over, and the next creature’s turn begins.
Translation:
当你处于一场紧张的战斗中，且每一个单独的动作都至关重要时，你就进入了一场遭遇。时代被划分为轮，每一轮相当于游戏世界中的6秒时代。（十号轮为1分钟。）每一轮中，战斗中的每个生物都会按照被称为先攻的既定顺序进行一个回合。一场遭遇遵循以下四个步骤进行。

步骤 1：投掷先攻

当遭遇开始时，GM会要求投掷先攻。投掷你的察觉（除非你在战斗爆发前正在“避开注意”，在这种情况下你投掷隐秘）。GM为遭遇中英雄以外的所有人投掷先攻。与典型的检定（其结果与DC进行比较）不同，先攻投掷的结果按从高到低的顺序排列。

步骤 2：进行一轮

这一轮从投出最高先攻的生物开始，由其率先进行回合。进行回合的过程将在下文详述。

一旦第一个生物结束了其回合，先攻次高的生物接着进行其回合，以此类推。如果先攻结果相同，敌人排在英雄之前。如果同一方的生物结果相同，他们在第一次轮到其先攻位次时决定行动顺序。此后，在该遭遇的休息时间内，每个人的先攻顺序不再改变。

一旦所有人都进行了一个回合，该轮结束，下一轮开始。

步骤 3：开始下一轮

先攻就像时钟一样——在所有战斗参与者都结束了他们的回合后，你将开始新的一轮。回到先攻数值最高的人，在新的一轮中，每个人按照相同的顺序再次进行一个回合。

步骤 4：结束遭遇

当一方的所有人都被击败、达成某种休战协议，或者其他事件或情况停止了战斗时，遭遇结束。你和其他参与者不再遵循先攻顺序，游戏回到探索模式。

在遭遇结束时，GM可能会向队伍发放经验值，或者你们可能会发现可以瓜分的宝藏。

进行你的回合

当战斗中轮到你的先攻位次时，你就可以进行你的回合了！你可以在你的回合中使用你的动作，并且在你的回合开始和结束时会适用一些特殊规则。以下是你在回合的每个阶段要做的事情。

你的回合开始

• 如果你创建了一个具有持续若干轮的持续时间的效果（如许多法术那样），将剩余轮数减1。如果持续时间减至0，则该效果结束。

• 如果你处于濒死状态，投掷一次复苏检定（参见 @UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.SucJycHedcDPml60]{生命值，治疗和死亡}）。

• 失去你上一个回合的反应动作，并重新获得你的3个动作和1个反应动作。你不能“豁免”下之前回合未使用的动作或反应动作。如果某种状态或效果阻止你使用部分（而非全部）动作，你仍然会获得剩余的动作。如果某种状态或效果阻止你使用所有动作，你将不会获得任何动作或反应动作。

使用动作

• 现在你有了动作，是时代使用它们了！你可以按任何你希望的顺序执行你的动作，但你必须在开始另一个动作之前完成当前这一个。例如，除非有特殊的行动允许，否则你不能在“行走（Stride）”中途进行“打击（Strike）”。你可以从所有角色通用的基础动作中选择你的动作，也可以从你的职业、族裔、装备或你在创建角色过程中做出的任何其他选择所获得的动作中进行选择。

• 一旦你用完了动作，进入你的回合结束阶段。

你的回合结束

• 失去你剩余的任何3个动作。如果你在你的回合中没有使用反应动作，你会保留它；你在下一个回合开始时失去它。

• 如果你正遭受 @UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.9H0Jrj0siUcpFC1s#persistent-damage]{持续性伤害}，你在此时代受到该伤害。在受到伤害后，你可以尝试进行纯骰检定来结束该持续性伤害。

• 结束任何持续到你回合结束的效果。

• 处理任何其他指定在你的回合结束时发生的事情。

• 你的回合结束，下一个生物的回合开始。

Original:
This premium content package includes audio mixed from the awesome sound collection provided by Syrinscape, including some conveniently placed Ambient Audio sources that are placed in key locations on the scene.

Ambient Sounds

Ambient Sounds are placed onto a scene, and will automatically play audio to players whose tokens are within their range. These can be used to create background atmospheric sounds that enhance immersion without needing micromanagement from the Gamemaster.

There will usually be specific instructions for how to handle the on-scene Ambient Sounds when your players first encounter them, but there is an expectation that you will know when an ambient sound is playing and disable it by right-clicking when appropriate. 

Did you know?

The playlists tab in the sidebar can be conveniently popped out into its own window by right-clicking its icon (the music note) in the sidebar.

Playlists

Other sounds are included as Playlists, which allow you to control exactly when and where they play in order to best set the mood, give your players audio cues, or respond to the events of the game.

As Gamemaster, you should take a few moments to familiarize yourself with the available sounds in the Playlists tab, so that you know which ones are available for your use throughout the adventure. Additional guidance on using the included playlists is included below.

Playlists In This Module

 Knowledge Base: Playlists

The tracklist and their intended uses are as follows:

Ambience

  • Exploration Loops (Simultaneous) - contains subtly looping audio to add some atmosphere to the act of exploring. They can be played individually, but clicking play on the playlist activates all three simultaneously, providing a soundscape with a faint bass drone of being underground, periodic wet drips to indicate a seaside cavern structure, and the sounds of rodents chittering and scratching.
  • Floor 1 Exploration Ambience - This playlist only contains a single audio file, a looping string of dramatic piano notes to add some musical themes of sneaky exploration. It is best used in conjunction with other ambience playlists.
  • Floor 2 Exploration Ambience - This playlist only contains a single audio file, a looping drone meant to convey the feeling of exploring a cavern deeper underground. It is best used in conjunction with other ambience playlists.
  • Floor 2 Mermaid Fountain - a faint ominous drone and amplified sounds of running water which, when coupled with the on-scene Ambient sounds of water running should provide a clear audio cue to players that something might be wrong and dangerous with the fountain.
  • Floor 2 Soggy Crossroads - This playlist should be used when players breach the barricade shortly after entering the second floor, as they near the water. It mixes the faint exploration piano from the first floor with heavy sounds of running water.
  • Otari Fishery - The goal of this track is to convey the sounds of a busy and bustling establishment, with drink and games served and the sounds of workers. It should be used when the players speak with Tamily.
  • Otari Wharf - A mix of sea birds and ocean waves to draw the players imagination to the sounds of a seaside town.
  • Soundboard Loops - This is a soundboard containing looping tracks which can be drawn upon to evoke particular sound effects. For example, during the encounter with the Cinder Rat you may wish to play the "Everything is Fire" track until the rat is defeated, or when your players breach the first barricade to explore northward, you may wish to begin playing "The Malevolent Dead".

Sound Effects

  • Barricades - these are the sound effect tracks which occur when players are removing the barricades, and can be replayed from here if the players miss out on hearing them.
  • Dragon Soundboard - Intended for use while players move into the Mushroom Grotto, these effects allow you to indicate the presence of a dragon and then, as combat begins, the sounds of the dragon attacking or being injured.
  • The Cinder Rat - The sound effect which plays when the Cinder Rat explodes out of the orb in @UUID[JournalEntry.qFSLpCM2cpRQWCR2.JournalEntryPage.7Ko4GJeI1K3Vy1Xp]{Area 14: Elements of Chaos}
Translation:
这个优质内容包包含了由 Syrinscape 提供的精彩音效集混合而成的音频，其中包括一些放置在场景关键位置的便捷环境音源。

环境音

环境音被放置在场景中，当玩家的指示物进入其射程内时，将自动为玩家播放音频。这些音效可用于创建增强沉浸感的背景氛围音，而无需游戏主持人进行微观管理。

当你的玩家第一次遭遇场景中的环境音时，通常会有关于如何处理它们的具体说明，但我们也希望你能了解环境音何时在播放，并在适当时通过右键单击将其禁用。 

你知道吗？

侧边栏中的播放列表标签页可以通过右键单击其图标（音符）方便地弹出到独立窗口中。

播放列表

其他声音以播放列表的形式包含在内，允许你精确控制它们播放的时间和地点，从而最好地烘托气氛、为玩家提供音频提示或响应游戏事件。

作为游戏主持人，你应该花点时间熟悉播放列表标签页中的可用声音，以便了解在整个冒险中哪些声音可供使用。下面还包含了关于使用所附播放列表的额外指南。

本模组中的播放列表

 知识库：播放列表

曲目列表及其预期用途如下：

环境氛围

  • 探索循环（同步）- 包含微妙的循环音频，为探索行为增添氛围。它们可以单独播放，但点击播放列表上的播放按钮会同时激活所有三个音轨，提供一个包含地下微弱低频嗡鸣声、表示海滨洞穴结构的周期性水滴声以及啮齿动物吱吱叫和抓挠声的声景。
  • 第一层探索氛围 - 此播放列表仅包含一个音频文件，是一串循环的戏剧性钢琴音符，为潜行探索增添了一些音乐主题。最好与其他环境氛围播放列表配合使用。
  • 第二层探索氛围 - 此播放列表仅包含一个音频文件，是一个循环的嗡鸣声，旨在传达探索更深地下洞穴的感觉。最好与其他环境氛围播放列表配合使用。
  • 第二层美人鱼喷泉 - 微弱的不祥嗡鸣声和放大的流水声，当与场景中流水环境音结合时，应能为玩家提供清晰的音频提示，表明喷泉可能存在问题且十分危险。
  • 第二层潮湿十字路口 - 当玩家进入二层后不久拆除路障并靠近水边时，应使用此播放列表。它将一层微弱的探索钢琴声与沉重的流水声混合在一起。
  • 奥塔里渔场 - 此音轨的目标是传达一个繁忙喧嚣场所的声音，包括供应饮料和游戏的声音以及工人的声音。当玩家与塔米莉交谈时应使用它。
  • 奥塔里码头 - 海鸟和海浪的混合，将玩家的想象力带入海滨小镇的声音中。
  • 音板循环 - 这是一个包含循环音轨的音板，可用于唤起特定的音效。例如，在与煤渣鼠的遭遇期间，你可能希望播放“Everything is Fire”音轨直到老鼠被击败；或者当你的玩家拆除第一个路障向北探索时，你可能希望开始播放“邪恶的死者”。

音效

  • 路障 - 这些是玩家拆除路障时出现的音效果音轨，如果玩家错过了听这些声音，可以从这里重放。
  • 巨龙音板 - 旨在当玩家进入蘑菇洞穴时使用，这些效果允许你提示巨龙的存在，然后在战斗开始时播放巨龙攻击或受伤的声音。
  • 煤渣鼠 - 当煤渣鼠从@UUID[JournalEntry.qFSLpCM2cpRQWCR2.JournalEntryPage.7Ko4GJeI1K3Vy1Xp]{区域 14：混乱的元素}中爆炸而出时播放的音效果。
