Original:
If you make an attack and it hits, or if you successfully cast a spell to harm your foe, you’ll roll dice to determine how much you hurt an enemy. Roll the kind and number of dice indicated by your weapon or spell, and add any numbers listed for that ability (for example, many weapons say to add your Strength to the damage for melee Strikes).

The damage you deal has a type, such as piercing or fire, which can matter since some creatures take more or less damage depending on the type.

Damage you deal decreases the target’s Hit Points by the same amount, so a creature that takes 6 damage loses 6 Hit Points. If penalties to an attack would reduce its damage to 0 or below, you still deal 1 damage. For example, if you threw a dagger and rolled a 1 on the damage roll while you had a –1 penalty to damage rolls, you still deal 1 damage to your target.

Doubling and Halving

You might need to double or halve your damage, depending on the action you used. For instance, many spells deal half damage if your enemy succeeds at its save, full damage if it fails, and double damage if it critically fails. You double or halve the damage after rolling rather than changing the number of dice you roll. Add any bonuses or penalties before you double or halve. Special damage—like the extra damage from a rogue’s sneak attack—is doubled or halved, too. If you halve damage that’s an odd number, round down.

Persistent Damage

Persistent damage, like bleeding or being on fire, hurts you over time. When you gain persistent damage, you don’t take it right away. Instead, you take it at the end of your turn each round. After you take the damage, you attempt a DC 15 flat check (roll a 15 or higher on a d20 without adding anything) to see if you recover from the persistent damage.

Immunities, Weaknesses, and Resistances

Damage might affect a creature differently if it has an immunity, weakness, or resistance to that damage type. Immunity prevents the creature from taking any damage at all. A weakness causes the creature to increase damage they take by the listed amount, and resistance prevents the listed amount of damage. So if you used a spell that deals 10 fire damage, a creature that’s immune to fire would take no damage, a creature with weakness 5 to fire would lose 15 Hit Points, and a creature with resistance 5 to fire would lose 5 Hit Points. This adjustment applies to every instance of damage, so if you made three Strikes that deal bludgeoning damage against a creature with resistance 5 to bludgeoning damage, it would take 5 less damage from each of the three strikes! Usually, heroes don’t have immunities or weaknesses, though the resist energy wizard spell can give resistance to some damage types.

Immunity matters for more than just damage. A creature that’s immune to a certain trait is completely unaffected by anything with that trait, and one with immunity to a condition can’t gain that condition. For instance, a creature without a mind lists “mental” in its immunities. Not only would it take no mental damage, but a spell with the mental trait wouldn’t do anything to it at all! In some cases, a creature is immune to part of an attack or spell but not the rest, and the GM determines whether this is the case. For instance, if you hit a monster that’s immune to fire with a flaming sword, the sword itself would still deal slashing damage, but the extra fire damage wouldn’t do anything.

Damaging Items

The rules for attacking and damaging items differ from the rules for creatures. Attacks and spells don’t normally damage items, except for traps, unless specified otherwise. If you have a shield, it can take damage if you use the Shield Block reaction.

Applying Damage in Foundry

Beneath any damage roll in chat, you'll see a row of buttons that allow you to easily apply damage to selected tokens. While you have a token selected, pressing the "damage", "double", or "half" buttons will apply that much damage. There's also "heal", which instead restores that many hit points. If your character is using a shield, and you would like to block a hit, then you can toggle the "block" button on before doing this to subtract the appropriate amount of damage.

This helpful timesaving feature is widely useful, but it does have limitations. Currently, the system does not automate damage resistances, weaknesses, or immunities- if your heroes or the NPCs they are facing have such abilities, you may need to adjust the damage taken.
Translation:
如果你进行一次攻击并命中，或者你成功施放了一个伤害敌人的法术，你将投掷骰子来决定你对敌人造成了多少伤害。投掷你的武器或法术所指示的骰子种类和数量，并加上该能力所列出的任何数值（例如，许多武器会说明在近战打击中将你的力量加到伤害上）。

你造成的伤害具有一种类型，例如穿刺或火焰，这很重要，因为某些生物会根据类型受到更多或更少的伤害。

你造成的伤害会减少目标等量的生命值，因此受到6点伤害的生物会失去6点生命值。如果对攻击的减值将其伤害降低到0或更低，你仍然会造成1点伤害。例如，如果你投掷一把匕首，在伤害投骰中掷出1，而你的伤害投骰有-1的减值，你仍然会对你的目标造成1点伤害。

翻倍与减半

根据你使用的动作，你可能需要将伤害翻倍或减半。例如，如果你的敌人豁免成功，许多法术会造成一半伤害；如果失败，则造成全部伤害；如果大失败，则造成双倍伤害。你应该在投骰后将伤害翻倍或减半，而不是改变你投掷的骰子数量。在翻倍或减半之前加上任何加值或减值。特殊伤害——例如游荡者偷袭攻击的额外伤害——也会翻倍或减半。如果你将奇数的伤害减半，请向下取整。

持续伤害

持续伤害，如流血或着火，会随时代推移对你造成伤害。当你获得持续伤害时，你不会立即受到伤害。相反，你在每轮自己的回合结束时受到伤害。在你受到伤害后，你尝试一次DC 15的纯骰检定（在d20上掷出15或更高，不加任何修正）来查看你是否从持续伤害中恢复。

免疫、弱点与抗力

如果一个生物对某种伤害类型具有免疫、弱点或抗力，伤害对其产生的影响可能会有所不同。免疫会完全阻止生物受到任何伤害。弱点会使生物受到的伤害增加列出的数值，而抗力会抵消列出的伤害数值。因此，如果你使用一个造成10点火焰伤害的法术，免疫火焰的生物将不会受到伤害，具有火焰弱点 5的生物将失去15点生命值，而具有火焰抗力 5的生物将失去5点生命值。这种调整适用于每一次伤害，因此如果你对一个具有钝击伤害抗力 5的生物进行了三次造成钝击伤害的打击，它在三次打击中每一次受到的伤害都会减少5点！通常，英雄没有免疫或弱点，尽管法师的抵御能量法术可以提供对某些伤害类型的抗力。

免疫的作用不仅仅体现在伤害上。免疫某种特征的生物完全不受任何具有该特征的事物的影响，而具有某种状态免疫的生物无法获得该状态。例如，没有心智的生物在其免疫列表中列出了“心智（mental）”。它不仅不会受到心智伤害，而且具有心智特征的法术对其完全不起作用！在某些情况下，生物对攻击或法术的一部分免疫，但对休息不免疫，GM将决定是否属于这种情况。例如，如果你用一把火焰剑击中一个免疫火焰的怪物，剑本身仍会造成挥砍伤害，但额外的火焰伤害将不起作用。

伤害物品

攻击和伤害物品的规则与生物的规则不同。除非另有说明，攻击和法术通常不会对物品造成伤害，陷阱除外。如果你有一面盾牌，如果你使用盾牌格挡反应，它可能会受到伤害。

在 Foundry 中应用伤害

在聊天框中的任何伤害投骰下方，你会看到一排按钮，让你能够轻松地将伤害应用到选中的 Token 上。当你选中一个 Token 时，按下“damage”、“double”或“half”按钮将应用相应数值的伤害。还有一个“heal”按钮，它改为恢复相应数值的生命值。如果你的角色正在使用盾牌，并且你想要格挡一次攻击，那么你可以在执行此操作前开启“block”按钮，以减去相应的伤害数值。

这个省时的辅助功能非常有用，但它也有局限性。目前，系统不会自动处理伤害抗力、弱点或免疫——如果你的英雄或他们面对的 NPC 拥有此类能力，你可能需要手动调整受到的伤害。

Original:
Blessed with divine magic, you live the ideals of your faith, adorn yourself with the symbols of your church, and train diligently with your deity’s favored weapon. Your spells might protect and heal your allies, or they might punish foes and enemies of your faith, as your deity wills.

Play a Cleric If You Want To...

  • Support and heal your allies with divine spells.
  • Fight with the favored weapon of your deity.
  • Know about religious writing and images.
  • Oppose and destroy evil undead creatures.

During Combat Encounters...

You balance between casting spells and attacking with weapons—typically the favored weapon of your deity. Most of your spells can boost, protect, or heal your allies.

While Exploring...

You detect nearby magic and interpret any religious writing or icons you come across. You might also concentrate on a protective spell for your allies in case of attack. After a battle or hazard, you might heal anyone who was hurt.

The Iconic Cleric: Kyra

@Actor[yoAU5rWYH4KJGPr5]{Kyra}

Kyra is a priestess of @Compendium[pf2e.deities.BNycwu3I21dTh4D9]{Sarenrae}, a sun goddess who teaches her followers to heal the wounded and destroy evil. Kyra grew up admiring the beautiful stained glass of Sarenrae's temple and the graceful priestesses who practiced with their scimitars each dawn.

When bandits attacked Kyra's village, those priestesses fought to the death to protect the villagers, but the bandits were too many and the village burned. Kyra was one of the few survivors, and on the smoking ruins of the beautiful temple she swore her life and sword arm to Sarenrae, promising to protect those who could not protect themselves and to slay those who would harm the innocent.

Kyra has a fierce will, and is proud of her faith and her skill with the scimitar.
Translation:
蒙受神圣魔法的恩赐，你践行着信仰的理想，佩戴着教会的圣徽，并勤奋地练习你神祇的偏好武器。你的法术可能会保护并治疗你的盟友，也可能会惩罚你信仰的仇敌，一切皆如你神祇所愿。

如果你想……就玩牧师

  • 用神圣法术支援并治疗你的盟友。
  • 使用你神祇的偏好武器战斗。
  • 了解宗教典籍和圣像。
  • 对抗并摧毁邪恶的不死生物。

在战斗遭遇中……

你在施放法术和使用武器攻击之间寻求平衡——通常是你神祇的偏好武器。你的大多数法术可以强化、保护或治疗你的盟友。

在探索时……

你侦测附近的魔法，并解读你遇到的任何宗教典籍或圣像。你可能还会为盟友维持一个防御性的法术以防备攻击。在战斗或危害之后，你可能会治疗任何受伤的人。

传奇牧师：凯拉

@Actor[yoAU5rWYH4KJGPr5]{凯拉}

凯拉是@Compendium[pf2e.deities.BNycwu3I21dTh4D9]{莎伦莱}的祭司，这位太阳女神教导她的信徒治疗伤者并摧毁邪恶。凯拉在成长过程中一直仰慕着莎伦莱神庙里美丽的彩色玻璃，以及每天黎明练习弯刀的优雅祭司们。

当土匪袭击凯拉的村庄时，那些祭司为了保护村民战至最后一刻，但土匪人数太多，村庄被焚毁了。凯拉是少数幸存者之一，在美丽神庙冒着烟的废墟上，她向莎伦莱宣誓献出生命和持剑之手，承诺保护那些无法保护自己的人，并斩杀那些伤害无辜的人。

凯拉意志坚定，并为自己的信仰和使用弯刀的技能感到自豪。

root.entries.Menace Under Otari.journals.Menace Under Otari.pages.The Barricade.text
Involved Terms: background->背景 | Perception->察觉 | movement->移动 | movement->移动 | movement->移动 | success->成功 | effect->效果 | object->物体 | check->检定 | check->检定 | check->检定 | check->检定 | level->等级 | skill->技能 | skill->技能 | skill->技能 | skill->技能 | Otari->奥塔里 | area->区域 | area->区域 | area->区域 | area->区域 | area->区域 | area->区域 | area->区域 | time->时代
Original:
This intersection presents the heroes with a choice of which direction to go, and it includes a skill challenge that can affect their encounters further within the dungeon.

After the web-infested cave, the passageway leading deeper underneath the streets of Otari appears to be mostly natural, but someone, or something, has worked to open the cavern and level out the floor, making the passage easily traveled. A crude barricade made from old wooden planks and part of a barrel blocks the entrance to a side tunnel, while the main passage continues off into the gloom.

If any hero examines the barricade, ask them to attempt a @Check[type:perception|dc:15]{Perception Check}. On a success, they hear a faint clattering noise coming from somewhere beyond the barricade. The area is totally unlit, but characters with a torch or darkvision can tell that the tunnel opens up into a larger room ahead, with a large rectangular object in the middle.

There are two ways the heroes can take apart the barricade. They can easily destroy the barrier with their weapons, but this makes a great deal of noise and alerts the monsters in Area 5 of the heroes’ approach.

They can also try to take the barricade apart quietly by rolling a @Check[type:crafting|dc:15]{Crafting Skill Check} or @Check[type:thievery|dc:15]{Thievery Skill Check}. Their effort removes the barricade whether they succeed or fail, but if they fail, they make enough noise to alert the enemies in @UUID[.mJ3pVc1aJi98duaA]{Area 05}. If they succeed, they avoid alerting the monsters.

If you're using the Enhanced maps, there might be additional tools you can use to make this moment as smooth as possible. Make sure to read the informational box below to find out more!

Doors

 Knowledge Base: Walls

Here, the players are faced with an obstacle which inhibits movement and vision further down the tunnel to the north. You might notice a door icon on the map over the barricade- that's because this barricade is a door!

Doors in Foundry

In Foundry VTT, doors are simply a type of wall that can be opened by players or GMs that click on the icon. They can have the same traits as other types of walls- they block any combination of light, sound, vision, and movement, or none of them. Doors also have some extra options that normal walls can't- you can lock doors so that players can't open them, or even hide their icon from players to make "secret" doors that only the GM can open. To see these settings for yourself, you can navigate to the walls layer on your toolbar (the temple icon), and then double right-click on any wall node.

Clearing the Barricade

In this case, this wall is already preconfigured for you. It's "secret", which means it can only be seen or opened by the GM, and it blocks both movement and vision. Players will need to succeed a skill check to clear the barricade, at which point you simply need to remove it to let them pass. On the original maps, you can do this by simply clicking on the door icon.

If you're using our enhanced map, you also have the option of going a little further. We've included a tile on the scene that can be swapped out when the barricade is dismantled. We've even provided a macro to do it for you! When run, it plays a sound effect, determined by whether your party dismantled the barricade noisily or quietly. Then, after a short delay, it swaps out the tile and opens the door at the same time.

To use the macro, you need only click here @Macro[saQTdI63wy22v5yk]{Area 04 - Barricade} and begin narrating how your players bypass the obstacle as the sounds play in the background.

Other Doors In This Adventure

There's a locked door in @UUID[.UCEZLyerntYnmzgX]{Area 07}, and there are similar obstacles to the barricade in @UUID[.2KRdW68qNXeJ6JpN]{Area 12} and @UUID[.CMjhAWaRWlbFVoF0]{Area 15} which both have macros provided as well.

Experience Points

If the heroes quietly take apart the barricade, award them each 10 XP.
Translation:
这个路口为英雄们提供了前进方向的选择，其中包含一项技能挑战，这可能会影响他们在地下城深处的遭遇。

在蛛网密布的洞穴之后，通往奥塔里街道下方的通道看起来大多是自然形成的，但有人或某种生物曾努力开凿洞穴并平整地面，使通道变得易于通行。一道由旧木板和部分木桶组成的粗糙路障堵住了一条侧边隧道的入口，而主通道则继续延伸向黑暗之中。

如果有英雄检查路障，请让他们尝试一次 @Check[type:perception|dc:15]{察觉 检定}。如果成功，他们会听到路障后方某处传来微弱的咔哒声。该区域完全没有照明，但持有火把或拥有黑暗视觉的角色可以辨认出隧道通向前方一个更大的房间，中间有一个巨大的矩形物体。

英雄们有两种拆除路障的方法。他们可以用武器轻易摧毁屏障，但这会产生巨大的噪音，并提醒区域 5 中的怪物英雄们正在靠近。

他们也可以尝试通过掷骰进行 @Check[type:crafting|dc:15]{工艺 技能 检定} 或 @Check[type:thievery|dc:15]{贼活 技能 检定} 来悄悄拆除路障。无论成功还是失败，他们的努力都会移除路障，但如果失败，他们发出的噪音足以惊动 @UUID[.mJ3pVc1aJi98duaA]{区域 05} 中的敌人。如果成功，他们就能避免惊动怪物。

如果你正在使用增强版地图，可能会有一些额外的工具可以帮助你尽可能顺畅地处理这一时刻。请务必阅读下方的说明框以了解更多信息！

门

 知识库：墙壁

在这里，玩家面临着一个阻碍向北隧道进一步移动和视线的障碍。你可能会注意到地图上路障上方有一个门图标——那是因为这个路障就是一扇门！

Foundry 中的门

在 Foundry VTT 中，门只是一种墙壁类型，玩家或 GM 点击图标即可将其打开。它们可以具有与其他类型墙壁相同的特质——它们可以阻挡光线、声音、视觉和移动的任何组合，或者都不阻挡。门还有一些普通墙壁没有的额外选项——你可以锁定门，让玩家无法打开，甚至可以对玩家隐藏其图标，制作只有 GM 才能打开的“秘密”门。要亲自查看这些设置，你可以导航到工具栏上的墙壁层（神庙图标），然后双击任何墙壁节点。

清除路障

在这种情况下，这面墙已经为你预先配置好了。它是“秘密”的，这意味着它只能由 GM 看到或打开，并且它同时阻挡了移动和视觉。玩家需要成功通过一次技能 检定来清除路障，届时你只需将其移除即可让他们通过。在原始地图上，你只需点击门图标即可完成此操作。

如果你正在使用我们的增强版地图，你还可以选择更进一步。我们在场景中包含了一个图块，可以在拆除路障时进行更换。我们甚至提供了一个宏来为你完成这项工作！运行时，它会根据你的队伍是吵闹还是安静地拆除路障来播放声音效果。然后，在短暂的延迟后，它会更换图块并同时打开门。

要使用该宏，你只需点击这里 @Macro[saQTdI63wy22v5yk]{区域 04 - 路障}，并在背景播放声音时开始叙述你的玩家如何绕过障碍。

本冒险中的其他门

@UUID[.UCEZLyerntYnmzgX]{区域 07} 有一扇锁着的门，@UUID[.2KRdW68qNXeJ6JpN]{区域 12} 和 @UUID[.CMjhAWaRWlbFVoF0]{区域 15} 也有与路障类似的障碍，这两处也都提供了宏。

经验值

如果英雄们悄悄拆除路障，奖励每人 10 XP。

JSON Path: root.entries.Menace Under Otari.journals.Menace Under Otari.pages.Gold Puzzle.text
Involved Terms: adventure->冒险 | religion->宗教 | treasure->宝藏 | treasure->宝藏 | treasure->宝藏 | success->成功 | access->许可 | wealth->财富 | wealth->财富 | check->检定 | check->检定 | coins->钱币 | coins->钱币 | coins->钱币 | coins->钱币 | coins->钱币 | coins->钱币 | coins->钱币 | coins->钱币 | coins->钱币 | coins->钱币 | coins->钱币 | coins->钱币 | coins->钱币 | coins->钱币 | skill->技能 | skill->技能 | area->区域 | area->区域 | area->区域 | area->区域 | area->区域
Original:
This chamber contains a puzzle. If the heroes solve the puzzle, they can gain extra treasure and make their explorations safer! Read the following aloud when the heroes enter this room.

The door to this chamber silently glides open to reveal a long room. Two stone statues of priests stand in the corners along one side of the room, facing a towering statue of a man holding out both of his hands, palms up. In front of this statue is a stone altar holding nine golden coins. A voice booms out from the statue.
"In my hands I judge the value of all wealth, raising up whichever is greater. One of these coins is a deception. Find it using only two judgments and receive my blessing.”

Players curious about the statue can attempt a @Check[type:religion|dc:10]{Religion Skill Check} skill check. On a success, they know the statue depicts Abadar, the god of wealth and civilization.

The Puzzle

The statue and the coins represent a puzzle. The challenge here is to identify which of the coins is fake. All of them look identical and they all weigh exactly the same, but the fake coin is worth less than the others. Explain to the players that when the heroes place coins in the statue’s hands, it will raise the hand that has a higher value. So if the heroes put four coins in each hand and the right hand contains the fake, the statue will raise the left hand. After two attempts, the statue asks the heroes to identify the fake.

If they fail to identify the fake coin, all the coins vanish and reappear in a random order atop the altar. If the coins are taken from the altar and not placed in the hands, they also vanish and the puzzle resets. Any real coins added to the puzzle vanish immediately, added to the vault in @UUID[.gz9x5HmzjSvvBLQp]{Area 10}. The heroes can try again as many times as they’d like. Failing to solve this puzzle doesn’t prevent the heroes from completing the adventure, but it does make the next combat a bit more challenging because of the trap in @UUID[.KWTky7M63NvVIVRz]{Area 11}.

If they succeed, the real coins fall to the floor and the heroes can take them as treasure (each is worth 1 gp), while the fake coin turns to lead. In addition, the door to Area 10 slowly swings open (you can reveal this area by clicking on the secret door to open it), which gives the heroes access to Abadar’s treasure and allows them to adjust the traps in Area 11 to work in their favor.

When running this puzzle for the players, tell the players they must decide how they want to weigh coins numbered 1 through 9, and secretly pick which number represents the fake coin. If they fail to identify the fake coin and decide to try again, pick a new number (since the puzzle resets). The players might accidentally pick the fake coin without solving the puzzle, and that’s okay—adventurers get lucky sometimes! To make this puzzle simpler, you might want to provide props, like pieces of paper with a coin drawn on each one, numbered 1 through 9.

The Solution

The trick to solving the puzzle is to split the coins into three groups of three coins each. By placing one group of three in each hand and leaving the third group on the altar, the players can determine which group contains the fake coin. If one hand rises, the other hand contains the fake. If neither rises, then the fake is in the three coins that were left on the altar. The heroes then need to repeat this process with the group containing the fake, by placing one coin in each hand and leaving the third on the altar. If one hand rises, the coin in the other hand is the fake. If neither rises, the coin on the altar is the fake.

Experience Points

Not all challenges are dangerous! If the heroes solve the puzzle, award them each 80 XP.
Translation:
这个房间包含一个谜题。如果英雄们解开了这个谜题，他们可以获得额外的宝藏，并让他们的探索更加安全！当英雄们进入这个房间时，大声朗读以下内容。

通往这个房间的门静静地滑开，露出一个长方形的房间。两尊祭司石像站在房间一侧的角落里，面对着一尊高大的男子雕像，他伸出双手，手掌向上。在这尊雕像前有一个石质祭坛，上面放着九枚金色的钱币。雕像中传出一个低沉的声音。
“我以双手裁决所有财富的价值，举起其中价值更高的一方。这些钱币中有一枚是虚假的。仅用两次裁决找出它，便可获得我的祝福。”

对雕像感到好奇的玩家可以尝试一次@Check[type:religion|dc:10]{宗教 技能 检定}技能检定。若成功，他们会知道这尊雕像描绘的是财富与文明之神阿巴达尔。

谜题

雕像和钱币代表了一个谜题。这里的挑战是辨别哪枚钱币是假的。它们看起来完全一样，重量也完全相同，但假币的价值比其他的要低。向玩家解释，当英雄们将钱币放在雕像手中时，它会举起价值更高的那只手。因此，如果英雄们在每只手中各放四枚钱币，而右手包含假币，雕像就会举起左手。经过两次尝试后，雕像会要求英雄们指出假币。

如果他们未能辨别出假币，所有的钱币都会消失，并以随机顺序重新出现在祭坛上。如果钱币从祭坛上被拿走而没有放在手中，它们也会消失且谜题重置。任何加入谜题的真钱币都会立即消失，被添加到@UUID[.gz9x5HmzjSvvBLQp]{区域 10}的金库中。英雄们可以根据意愿尝试任意多次。未能解开这个谜题并不会阻止英雄们完成冒险，但由于@UUID[.KWTky7M63NvVIVRz]{区域 11}中的陷阱，这会让接下来的战斗变得更具挑战性。

如果他们成功了，真的钱币会掉到地板上，英雄们可以将其作为宝藏带走（每枚价值 1 gp），而假币则会变成铅。此外，通往区域 10的门会慢慢开启（你可以通过点击秘密门来开启并揭示该区域），这让英雄们得以许可获得阿巴达尔的宝藏，并允许他们调整区域 11中的陷阱使其对己方有利。

为玩家运行这个谜题时，告诉玩家他们必须决定如何称量编号为 1 到 9 的钱币，并秘密挑选哪个数字代表假币。如果他们未能辨别出假币并决定再次尝试，请挑选一个新的数字（因为谜题会重置）。玩家可能会在没有解开谜题的情况下意外选中假币，这也没关系——冒险者有时就是运气好！为了让这个谜题更简单，你可能需要提供道具，比如在每张纸片上画一枚硬币，编号为 1 到 9。

解法

解决这个谜题的诀窍是将钱币分成三组，每组三枚钱币。通过在每只手中各放一组（三枚），并将第三组留在祭坛上，玩家可以确定哪一组包含假币。如果一只手举起，则另一只手包含假币。如果两只手都没有举起，那么假币就在留在祭坛上的那三枚钱币中。英雄们随后需要对包含假币的那组重复此过程，即在每只手中各放一枚硬币，将第三枚留在祭坛上。如果一只手举起，另一只手中的硬币就是假币。如果两只手都没有举起，祭坛上的硬币就是假币。

经验值

并非所有挑战都是危险的！如果英雄们解开了谜题，奖励他们每人 80 XP。

Involved Terms: Scratch Paper->草稿纸 | character->角色 | darkness->黑暗 | actions->动作 | actions->动作 | attack->攻击 | attack->攻击 | attack->攻击 | attack->攻击 | attack->攻击 | attack->攻击 | attack->攻击 | damage->伤害 | damage->伤害 | armor->护甲 | class->职业 | rest->休息 | turn->回合 | turn->回合 | turn->回合 | turn->回合 | Will->意志 | time->时代
Original:
The passageway winds through ancient rock, but it's clear that someone has made it wider with a pickaxe, although it looks like the work was done many years ago. After squeezing hurriedly through a narrow crevice with a ceiling supported only by a rotting log, you find yourself in a small chamber. Roots grow down from above, breaking through the ceiling and letting in faint, dappling light here and there across the cavern. Opposite the entrance is another corridor, but before you can head down that way, you hear a terrible hissing sound coming from the passageway. Emerging from the darkness is a gigantic snake with terrifying fangs!

You are now in combat with a snake! Just as when fighting the wolf, you and the snake will take turns attacking one another until one side is defeated, but there are a few new things to pay attention to in this combat. In this fight, the snake gets to go first, but during its first turn, it must spend 2 of its 3 actions to close the distance before it can attack. So, on the snake’s first turn, it gets to spend only 1 action to attack you. On the rest of its turns it spends all 3 actions attacking.

On your turn, you can attack, just like in the previous fight. Unfortunately, there’s nothing to hide behind in this chamber, so you can’t boost your Armor Class like you could in the wolf fight. Also, if you took any damage in the last fight, remember that your HP still hasn't recovered!

1 Strike with Your Shortsword

See @UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.IrDInT1GRf8tKGyg]{Scratch Paper} for your Shortsword's statistics.

Snake

Snake's AC: 15

Snake's Hit Points: 8

1 Move

The snake moves 20 feet. This is called a Stride. It must use this action twice on its first turn to be next to you so that it can attack.

1 Bite

The snake tries to bite you with its fangs.

First Attack: [[/r 1d20+8 #Snake Bite 1]]

Second Attack: [[/r 1d20+3 #Snake Bite 2]]

Third Attack: [[/r 1d20-2 #Snake Bite 3]]

Damage: [[/r 1d4 #Snake Damage]]

Dealing with Poison

Whenever the snake bites you, it might poison you. This happens as part of the bite, so it doesn't use an action. When you are hit by the snake's bite, you must attempt a Saving Throw to resist the effects of the venom. Saving throws are special rolls to resist things that try to harm or control your character. There are three kinds of saving throws: Reflex saving throws are used to dodge a bolt of lightning or a fearsome dragon's fire breath; Will saving throws are used to resist spells that try to take over your mind; and Fortitude saving throws are used to fight off poisons and diseases.

You must attempt a Fortitude saving throw every time the snake bites you. Roll [[/r 1d20+8 #Fortitude Save]]. If the result is equal to or greater than 16 (the DC of the poison), you fight it off and nothing happens. If the result is 15 or lower, you take an additional [[/r 1d8 #Poison Damage]] damage from the poison.

 

If you defeat the snake, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.2VEQBTTitpdxSDrL]{#08}.

If you succumb to the snake and its poison, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]{#17}.
Translation:
通道在古老的岩石间蜿蜒，但显然有人曾用镐头将其拓宽，尽管这看起来像是多年前的工程。在匆忙挤过一道仅由一根腐朽木头支撑顶棚的狭窄裂缝后，你发现自己置身于一个小石室中。树根从上方垂下，穿透了顶棚，让微弱而斑驳的光线零星地洒入洞穴。入口对面是另一条走廊，但在你朝那边走去之前，你听到通道中传来一阵可怕的嘶嘶声。从黑暗中现身的是一条长着恐怖尖牙的巨蛇！

你现在正与一条蛇战斗！就像之前与狼战斗时一样，你和蛇将轮流攻击对方，直到一方被击败，但这场战斗中有一些新情况需要注意。在这场战斗中，蛇先行动，但在它的第一个回合中，它必须花费3个动作中的2个来拉近距离，然后才能进行攻击。因此，在蛇的第一个回合，它只能花费1个动作来攻击你。在它休息的回合中，它会花费全部3个动作进行攻击。

在你的回合，你可以进行攻击，就像之前的战斗一样。不幸的是，这间石室里没有可以躲藏的地方，所以你不能像在狼战中那样提升你的护甲 职业。另外，如果你在上一场战斗中受到了任何伤害，请记住你的生命值（HP）还没有恢复！

1 使用短剑打击

查看 @UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.IrDInT1GRf8tKGyg]{草稿纸} 以了解短剑的统计数据。

蛇

蛇的AC：15

蛇的生命值：8

1 移动

蛇移动20英尺。这被称为行走（Stride）。它必须在第一个回合使用两次该动作以靠近你，以便进行攻击。

1 啃咬

蛇尝试用它的尖牙咬你。

第一次攻击： [[/r 1d20+8 #Snake Bite 1]]

第二次攻击： [[/r 1d20+3 #Snake Bite 2]]

第三次攻击： [[/r 1d20-2 #Snake Bite 3]]

伤害： [[/r 1d4 #Snake Damage]]

处理毒素

每当蛇咬中你时，它可能会让你中毒。这是啃咬的一部分，因此不消耗动作。当你被蛇咬中时，你必须尝试一次豁免骰（Saving Throw）来抵抗毒液的效果。豁免骰是用于抵抗试图伤害或控制你角色的特殊掷骰。豁免骰共有三种：反射（Reflex）豁免用于躲避闪电束或可怕巨龙的喷吐武器；意志豁免用于抵抗试图控制你心智的法术；而强韧（Fortitude）豁免则用于抵抗毒素和疾病。

你必须在每时代蛇咬中你时尝试一次强韧豁免。掷 [[/r 1d20+8 #Fortitude Save]]。如果结果等于或大于16（毒素的DC），你成功抵抗了它，什么也不会发生。如果结果为15或更低，你会受到来自毒素的额外 [[/r 1d8 #Poison Damage]] 伤害。

 

如果你击败了蛇，转到条目 @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.2VEQBTTitpdxSDrL]{#08}。

如果你死于蛇和它的毒素，转到条目 @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]{#17}。

JSON Path: root.entries.Menace Under Otari.journals.Menace Under Otari.pages.Forgotten Shrine.text
Involved Terms: Saltwater Sickness->海水恶心 | Saltwater Sickness->海水恶心 | character sheet->角色卡 | status penalty->状态减值 | status penalty->状态减值 | Ocean's Might->海洋之力 | character->角色 | character->角色 | critical->大成功或大失败 | critical->大成功或大失败 | duration->持续时间 | religion->宗教 | ability->能力 | penalty->减值 | success->成功 | success->成功 | attack->攻击 | attack->攻击 | damage->伤害 | damage->伤害 | effect->效果 | effect->效果 | effect->效果 | armor->护甲 | check->检定 | check->检定 | class->职业 | magic->魔法 | magic->魔法 | magic->魔法 | magic->魔法 | skill->技能 | skill->技能 | spell->法术 | touch->接触 | save->豁免 | save->豁免 | save->豁免 | time->时代
Original:
The door to this small shrine is hard to see from the passage, as the ledge is about 10 feet off the ground. A hero must succeed at a @Check[type:athletics|dc:10]{Athletics Skill Check} to climb up to the ledge. When the heroes enter the room, read the following aloud.

The ancient wooden door creaks open on rusty hinges, revealing a ruined chamber. Mold and rot stain every surface. On the far side of the room is stone statue of a giant squid, its tentacles reaching toward an altar in the center of the chamber. The scum covers almost everything, but it hasn’t touched the silver bowl sitting atop the stone altar. The water in the bowl is perfectly clear.

If the players ask about the shrine, ask them to roll a @Check[type:religion|dc:15]{Religion Skill Check}. If they succeed, they identify the shrine as one dedicated to Gozreh, the god of nature and the fury of the ocean. If anyone casts detect magic in this chamber, they sense the presence of magic.

The water in the silver bowl is pure and clean, but it carries a touch of Gozreh's magic. Anyone who drinks from the bowl regains [[/r 1d8 #healing]] Hit Points, but they must roll a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20]{Fortitude Save}.

If they fail, they feel the ocean's waves crash through their stomach, which makes them feel sick for the next hour. They take a -1 status penalty to all d20 rolls, their Armor Class, and spell DCs until the hour has passed. (You can drag this penalty effect to their token from the instructional box below.)

If they succeed at the Fortitude save, they feel the power of the ocean surge through them. In the next hour, they can call upon the ocean's might to fortify themself against harm. This power is a reaction that the hero can use when hit by a critical hit on an attack. This ability turns the critical success into an ordinary success (so the attack deals normal damage instead of double damage).

Each hero can get the bowl's benefits once per day; drinking a second time in a day has no effect. The bowl loses all of its magic if removed from this shrine, but can be sold for 5 gp.

Pathfinder Second Edition: Effects

@Item[XnvGgsstWwDeunij] @Item[od9RY509l6WGFawA]

Sometimes it can be difficult to keep track of effects with different durations and triggers. To help you and your players remember the duration of the blessing (or the curse), you can apply these effects to their characters by dragging them from here to their character sheet or onto their token- "Saltwater Sickness" for characters that failed their fortitude save, and "Ocean's Might" for characters that succeeded.

As well as being used to track durations, effects can also apply modifications to your character's stats. For instance, the Saltwater Sickness effect linked above will automatically apply a status penalty to the character's checks and DCs.
Translation:
从走廊上很难看到这个小神龛的门，因为高台距离地面约10尺。英雄必须成功通过一次@Check[type:athletics|dc:10]{运动 技能 检定}才能爬上高台。当英雄们进入房间时，大声朗读以下内容。

古老的木门在生锈的铰链上吱嘎作响地开启，露出一间破败的密室。霉菌和腐烂污蚀了每一个表面。在房间的远端是一座巨型乌贼石像，它的触手伸向密室中央的一座祭坛。污垢几乎覆盖了一切，但却没有触及放在石祭坛顶端的银碗。碗里的水清澈见底。

如果玩家询问关于神龛的事，请让他们进行一次@Check[type:religion|dc:15]{宗教 技能 检定}。如果成功，他们会认出这座神龛是献给自然与海洋之怒的神祇——哥兹莱的。如果有人在此密室施放探测魔法，他们会感知到魔法的存在。

银碗里的水纯净而清洁，但它带有一丝哥兹莱的魔法。任何饮用碗中之水的人都会恢复[[/r 1d8 #healing]]点生命值，但他们必须进行一次@Check[type:fortitude|dc:20]{强韧 豁免}。

如果失败，他们会感到海浪在胃中翻涌，这使他们在接下来的一个小时内感到恶心。直到一小时过去前，他们所有的d20掷骰、护甲 等级以及法术 DC都会受到-1状态减值。（你可以从下方的教学框中将此减值 效果拖动到他们的指示物上。）

如果成功通过强韧豁免，他们会感到大海的力量在体内涌动。在接下来的一个小时内，他们可以调用海洋之力来强化自己免受伤害。这种能力是一个反应动作，英雄可以在被一次攻击的重击命中时使用。此能力会将大成功 成功转变为普通成功（因此该攻击造成常规伤害而非双倍伤害）。

每位英雄每天只能获得一次银碗的益处；在一天内饮用第二次 次 没有效果。如果将银碗移出此神龛，它将失去所有魔法，但可以以5金币的价格出售。

寻路者第二版：效果

@Item[XnvGgsstWwDeunij] @Item[od9RY509l6WGFawA]

有时，追踪具有不同持续时间和触发条件的各种效果可能会很困难。为了帮助你和你的玩家记住祝福（或诅咒）的持续时间，你可以通过将这些效果从这里拖动到他们的角色卡或指示物上来应用到他们的角色上——强韧豁免失败的角色使用“海水恶心”，成功的角色使用“海洋之力”。

除了用于追踪持续时间外，效果还可以对你的角色属性应用修正。例如，上面链接的海水恶心 效果会自动对角色的检定和DC应用状态减值。

Involved Terms: A Wizard's Solution->一名法师的解答
Perception->察觉 | Perception->察觉 | Perception->察觉 | Perception->察觉 | check->检定 | check->检定 | check->检定 | check->检定 | class->职业 | skill->技能 | time->时代
Original:
Putting aside your fear, you squeeze your way through the crack into the narrow passageway beyond, lit only by faint light from above. If the cobwebs and dust are any indication, no one has been down this way for a long time. Up ahead, the passageway widens to form a cave chamber before veering to the left.

A curtain of moss grows on the right wall of the small cavern, fed by a trickle of water dripping from the cavern ceiling. Something about it looks odd, but you can’t quite figure it out without succeeding at a Perception check.

Your Perception indicates how good you are at noticing things. Your perception skill check is [[/r 1d20+4 #Perception]]. Once you have rolled, compare the total to the Difficulty Class (DC), which is 15. If your result is equal to or greater than the DC, you succeed!

If you succeed at the Perception check, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.EquPwVKE6qKVRygx]{#24}.

If you fail the Perception check, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Tov2M6Vpwc5JzBjM]{#21}.
Translation:
抛开恐惧，你挤过裂缝进入后方的狭窄通道，这里只有上方透进的微弱光线。如果蛛网和灰尘能说明什么，那就是已经有很长 时间 没有人走过这条路了。在前方，通道变宽形成一个洞室，随后向左转。

小洞窟的右侧墙壁上长着一帘苔藓，由洞顶滴落的细流滋养。它看起来有些古怪，但如果不成功通过一次 察觉 检定，你就无法看破其中的端倪。

你的 察觉 体现了你注意到事物的能力。你的察觉 技能 检定 为 [[/r 1d20+4 #Perception]]。掷骰后，将总值与难度 等级 (DC) 进行比较，此处为 15。如果你的结果等于或大于 DC，你就成功了！

如果你的 察觉 检定 成功，转到条目 @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.EquPwVKE6qKVRygx]{#24}。

如果你的 察觉 检定 失败，转到条目 @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Tov2M6Vpwc5JzBjM]{#21}。

Involved Terms: Floor 2 Soggy Crossroads->第二层浸水的路口 | status penalty->状态减值 | Otari Fishery->奥塔里渔场 | initiative->先攻 | initiative->先攻 | Perception->察觉 | Perception->察觉 | Perception->察觉 | Perception->察觉 | Perception->察觉 | Perception->察觉 | character->角色 | condition->状态 | encounter->遭遇 | ability->能力 | attack->攻击 | attack->攻击 | attack->攻击 | attack->攻击 | damage->伤害 | player->玩家 | kobold->狗头人 | kobold->狗头人 | kobold->狗头人 | kobold->狗头人 | kobold->狗头人 | kobold->狗头人 | kobold->狗头人 | check->检定 | check->检定 | check->检定 | cover->掩蔽 | level->等级 | level->等级 | level->等级 | level->等级 | level->等级 | level->等级 | spell->法术 | Otari->奥塔里 | area->区域 | area->区域 | area->区域 | area->区域 | turn->回合 | turn->回合
Original:
Floor Two

The challenges in the second level of the dungeon are more dangerous than those in the first level. In their explorations of this level, the players will learn the truth behind the missing fish. A band of kobolds under the city has recently hatched a horned dragon wyrmling, and have been raiding the Otari Fishery to provide a steady diet for their growing charge. If the heroes don’t defeat this menace, the dragon might grow up to spell doom for the town of Otari!

The players will have to use all their skills and abilities if they hope to defeat the kobolds—and the dragon. As with the first level, unless noted otherwise, the chambers in this level aren’t lit. The kobolds all have darkvision and have little need for light.

If you haven't already done so, activate the second level of the map to bring your players' focus to it, and place down their heroes' tokens on the staircase in this area.

The kobolds prepared this room to defend against any intruders and stationed two of their more capable guards to defend this place. Because they're hiding, don't reveal their tokens just yet. When the heroes descend the spiral staircase, read the following aloud.

The stairs spiral down deep into the earth before ending in a chamber that looks like it’s been prepared specifically to defend against intruders. On one side of the room, a table has been turned on its side to provide cover, while on the other, crates and barrels have been piled up to create a second barrier.

Hidden Kobolds

The kobold scouts begin this encounter hidden. Ask each player to tell you their Perception DC: their Perception + 10. Then roll a d20 and add the kobolds' Stealth. If the total is equal to or higher than the highest Perception DC from the heroes, the heroes don't notice the kobolds before they attack- the room looks like it's empty! Don't reveal the tokens on the map until the kobolds attack or they move out from behind their barricades, or until a hero moves around the barricades enough to see a hiding kobold. But if any hero's Perception DC is higher than the total of the kobold's Stealth check, the kobolds are spotted! Reveal their tokens on the map.

Either way, ask the players to roll initiative (using Perception unless a hero was hiding). Use the total from the kobolds' Stealth check for their initiative. If any heroes have their turn before the kobolds but the kobolds successfully hid themselves, the heroes know there are foes nearby, but they don't know where- they'll have to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} to find their enemies.

Encounter

@Actor[rPaHIh0ICnTLnRO6]{2 Kobold Scouts}

Kobold Tactics

If a kobold's turn starts while they're hidden, they fire their crossbow at a hero. That character has the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{off-guard} condition against the attack, which gives them a -2 status penalty to AC and allows the kobold to deal extra damage from their sneak attack ability. After this ranged Strike, the kobold is no longer hidden (reveal their tokens if you haven't already), and the fight proceeds normally.

Experience Points

For overcoming the kobolds in this room, award each hero 80 XP.

Smelly Barricade

Audio Cue

After your players breach the barricade, you may wish to start the Floor 2 Soggy Crossroads playlist. This will provide your players with the sounds of running water and denote a change in atmosphere.

There is a makeshift barricade in the back of this room. If the heroes examine this barricade, ask for a @Check[type:perception|dc:10]{Perception Check}. If the total is 10 or higher, they notice a foul stench coming from the passage behind the barricade—like rotten fish and sweat. If the total is 20 or higher, they also hear a faint sound of dripping water coming from somewhere in the distance.

If the heroes take this barricade apart, ask them if they tear it down or carefully disassemble it before you open the pathway-just like in @UUID[.Ccp3c9A1WH9tOCVO]{Area 04}. The creatures in the other rooms are too far away to hear any noise the heroes make, but the heroes have no way of knowing that!

Again, just like in Area 04, we've provided another macro you can use to automatically dismantle the barricade. To run it, just click @Macro[pb7k8V9m7cFioy6B]{Area 12 - Barricade}.
Translation:
第二层 Floor Two

地牢第二 等级 的挑战比第一 等级 更加危险。在探索这一 等级 的过程中，玩家将了解到鲜鱼失踪背后的真相。城市下方的一群狗头人最近孵化出了一只角龙雏龙，并且一直在袭击 奥塔里渔场，以为他们不断成长的负担提供稳定的饮食。如果英雄们不击败这个威胁，这条龙可能会为 奥塔里 镇 招致 毁灭！

如果玩家希望击败狗头人和这条龙，他们将不得不动用所有的技能和能力。与第一 等级 一样，除非另有说明，否则这一 等级 的房间没有照明。狗头人都拥有黑暗视觉，几乎不需要光亮。

如果你还没有这样做，请激活地图的第二 等级 以将玩家的注意力吸引到它上面，并将英雄的指示物放置在这一 区域 的楼梯上。

狗头人准备了这个房间来抵御任何入侵者，并驻扎了两个更有能力的守卫来保卫这里。因为他们躲藏着，所以先不要展示他们的指示物。当英雄们走下螺旋楼梯时，大声朗读以下内容。

楼梯螺旋向下深入地下，最后结束于一个看起来专门为抵御入侵者而准备的房间。在房间的一侧，一张桌子被侧翻以提供 掩蔽，而在另一侧，板条箱和木桶堆叠在一起形成了第二道屏障。

躲藏的狗头人 Hidden Kobolds

狗头人 斥候在 遭遇 开始时处于躲藏状态。要求每位 玩家 告诉你他们的 察觉 DC：他们的 察觉 + 10。然后投掷一个 d20 并加上狗头人的隐秘。如果总值等于或高于英雄中最高的 察觉 DC，英雄们在 攻击 之前不会注意到狗头人——房间看起来就像是空的！在狗头人 攻击 或从路障后移动出来之前，或者直到英雄绕过路障足以看到躲藏的 狗头人 之前，不要展示地图上的指示物。但如果任何英雄的 察觉 DC 高于 狗头人 的隐秘 检定 总值，狗头人就会被发现！展示他们在地图上的指示物。

无论哪种情况，请玩家投掷 先攻（除非英雄正在躲藏，否则使用 察觉）。使用狗头人隐秘 检定 的总值作为他们的 先攻。如果任何英雄在狗头人之前进行 回合，但狗头人成功躲藏了自己，英雄们知道附近有敌人，但不知道在哪里——他们必须 @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{寻获 Seek} 来寻找他们的敌人。

遭遇 Encounter

@Actor[rPaHIh0ICnTLnRO6]{2 狗头人 斥候 Scouts}

狗头人战术 Kobold Tactics

如果 狗头人 的 回合 在躲藏时开始，他们会向英雄发射十字弩。该 角色 对该 攻击 具有 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 off-guard} 状态，这会使他们的 AC 受到 -2 状态减值，并允许 狗头人 通过其偷袭 攻击 能力 造成额外 伤害。在这次远程打击之后，狗头人 不再处于躲藏状态（如果你还没有展示他们的指示物，请展示），战斗正常进行。

经验值 Experience Points

为了克服这个房间里的狗头人，奖励每位英雄 80 XP。

发臭的路障 Smelly Barricade

音频提示 Audio Cue

在你的玩家突破路障后，你可能希望开始播放 第二层浸水的路口 播放列表。这将为你的玩家提供流水声，并表示气氛的变化。

这个房间的后面有一个简陋的路障。如果英雄检查这个路障，要求进行一次 @Check[type:perception|dc:10]{察觉 检定}。如果总值为 10 或更高，他们会注意到路障后面的通道传来一股恶臭——就像腐烂的鱼和汗水。如果总值为 20 或更高，他们还会听到远处传来微弱的滴水声。

如果英雄拆除这个路障，在打开通道之前询问他们是将其拆毁还是小心地拆卸——就像在 @UUID[.Ccp3c9A1WH9tOCVO]{区域 04} 中一样。其他房间里的生物距离太远，听不到英雄发出的任何噪音，但英雄们无从得知这一点！

同样，就像在 区域 04 中一样，我们提供了另一个宏，你可以使用它来自动拆除路障。要运行它，只需点击 @Macro[pb7k8V9m7cFioy6B]{区域 12 - 路障 Barricade}。

Involved Terms: adventure->冒险 | adventure->冒险 | adventure->冒险 | adventure->冒险 | encounter->遭遇 | encounter->遭遇 | religion->宗教 | treasure->宝藏 | failure->失败 | success->成功 | Hazards->危害 | level->等级 | skill->技能 | Otari->奥塔里 | area->区域
Original:
Encounters are the big, dramatic points in your adventure. They often feature combat with other creatures, but they can also include @UUID[.f82BLxCvoOGIzQ7U]{Hazards}, or you might create social challenges in which characters duel only with words. The rules for building challenges appropriate to your group’s level, as well as how to run them, are contained within this journal.

Some adventures have a clear and direct progression, with challenges occurring at specific times or in a specific order. Others, such as a dungeon filled with interconnected rooms the group can investigate in any order, are nonlinear, and the group can face challenges in any order—or even avoid them entirely. Most adventures are somewhere in between, with some keystone challenges you know the heroes must contend with and some optional ones that the heroes could avoid.

Types of Encounter

Combat Encounters

The most common type of challenge is a combat encounter, where the heroes fight other creatures. As you plan your adventure, think about the kinds of creatures that fit your story. Not all of them have to be important to the plot. It’s okay to include monsters you think would just be fun to use! Think about your players, too. Include monsters you think they’d like going up against based on the players’ personalities.

While you’re picking encounters for your adventure, make notes about which area each encounter appears in and details about the creatures involved. This includes notes on their place in the adventure’s plot and any treasure you want them to carry. You can look at the rooms in “Menace under Otari” for the types of information to include, though you can just use brief notes instead of writing everything out in detail.

Social Interactions

Some conversations and other social interactions are important enough that you should treat them with the same importance as encounters. If major consequences can come from the conversation, success or failure really matters. These interactions should be worth XP. It’s usually a moderate accomplishment, but it might be a major one for something like talking a king out of going to war!

Social interactions don’t follow the same rules as combat. Roleplay them as a conversation, and have the heroes roll skill checks as appropriate. These are usually Deception, Diplomacy, and Intimidation, but players might think of something clever, like using Religion to make friends with a local priest. Remember that you can give heroes circumstance bonuses (usually +1 or +2) if their approach is really likely to work on the person they’re talking to.
Translation:
遭遇是你冒险中重大且富有戏剧性的时刻。它们通常以与其他生物的战斗为特色，但也可能包含@UUID[.f82BLxCvoOGIzQ7U]{危害}，或者你也可以创建仅用言语交锋的社交挑战。本日志中包含了为你的团队等级构建合适挑战的规则，以及如何运行它们的方法。

有些冒险有清晰且直接的进度，挑战发生在特定的时间或以特定的顺序。其他的，例如充满互连房间且团队可以按任何顺序进行调查的地城，是非线性的，团队可以按任何顺序面对挑战——甚至完全避开它们。大多数冒险介于两者之间，有一些你确信英雄必须应对的关键挑战，以及一些英雄可以避开的可选挑战。

遭遇类型

战斗遭遇

最常见的挑战类型是战斗遭遇，即英雄与其他生物战斗。当你规划你的冒险时，思考一下符合你故事的生物种类。并非所有生物都必须对剧情很重要。加入一些你认为使用起来很有趣的怪物也是可以的！也要考虑你的玩家。根据玩家的性格，加入一些你认为他们会喜欢对抗的怪物。

当你为你的冒险挑选遭遇时，记录下每个遭遇出现在哪个区域，以及涉及生物的详细信息。这包括关于它们在冒险剧情中的位置以及你希望它们携带的任何宝藏的笔记。你可以参考“奥塔里地底的威胁”中的房间来了解要包含的信息类型，不过你也可以只使用简短的笔记，而不是详细地写下所有内容。

社交互动

一些对话和其他社交互动非常重要，你应该像对待遭遇一样重视它们。如果对话可能产生重大后果，那么成功或失败就真的很重要。这些互动应该奖励经验值（XP）。这通常是一项中等成就，但对于像说服国王放弃战争之类的事情，它可能是一项重大成就！

社交互动不遵循与战斗相同的规则。将它们作为对话进行角色扮演，并让英雄根据需要进行技能检定。这些通常是欺骗、外交和威吓，但玩家可能会想到一些聪明的点子，比如使用宗教与当地牧师交朋友。记住，如果英雄的方法确实可能对他们交谈的人奏效，你可以给予他们环境加值（通常为+1或+2）。

Original:
You play out an adventure over a series of sessions, which usually last several hours and involve multiple encounters and some exploration. Each session can noticeably differ from the last. Think of a session as an episode of a TV show—  it should include some twists, turns, and changes so that the players are excited about what comes next.

Planning a Session

Often, the responsibility of scheduling the game falls on you as the GM since you have to prepare the game between sessions. Choose a time everyone can attend and a place to gather, whether it's around the kitchen table or in an online space. Many games have a set schedule, such as once per week, once every 2 weeks, or once per month. (Your first game might not be so predictable, though!) The less frequently your group meets, the better notes and recaps you'll need to keep everyone on the same page. If another player wants to take session notes, that's great too, especially if they set up a shared document everyone can reference online.

Plan a time for everybody to arrive, and also try to set a time when playing the game will begin. Having this planned can make it easier for everyone to finish catching up so you can start playing the game. Having an end time in mind is also important. A typical game session lasts about 4 hours. Less than 2 hours usually isn't enough time to get much done.

Starting a Session

Once everyone is ready to play, get everyone's attention and cover the following topics. These are in a rough order that you can change based on your group's style or a session's needs.

• Recap what happened during the previous sessions (if this isn't the first session).

• Establish where the heroes are at the beginning of this session. Have they been resting since their last challenge? Did you leave off with them in a hallway, preparing to raid the next room of a dungeon? Tell players whether their heroes had time to rest or recover since the last session.

• Establish goals. Repeat any goals the group already had, then let the players weigh in on whether these goals still apply and on whether there's anything else they hope to accomplish during the session.

• Commence adventuring! Usually the first thing you'll do in a session is describe the environment and sensations that surround the heroes, allowing them to react in the moment.

Running a Session

During a session, you're in charge of keeping the game's action moving, answering questions, and making rules decisions. You'll also want to keep a rough eye on the time, so you can end when it's most convenient for the group.

You're the one who customizes the rules you need from the imagined world you and the other players share. It's up to you to establish what's true in the world, but you have help in doing so! You're informed by the setting's backstory, your preparations, and the suggestions the other players make. You can adjust things on the fly from what you planned, too. You might have an idea in your notes that changes when a player does something unexpected.

You'll determine when heroes and foes need to attempt checks as well as what happens as a result of their rolls, which comes up most often during exploration. In an encounter, a player can usually determine their own hero's turn with you chiming in only to say whether an attack hits or if something in the environment requires a hero to attempt a check.

The Spotlight

As you run the game, keep track of which player has the spotlight. You can easily keep attention on the most outgoing player or hero, but you need to check in with all the players. If a player hasn't contributed in some time, stop and ask, "What's your hero doing at this point?" If the player isn't sure, add a detail or NPC to the scene that the player might find interesting.

Distractions and Interruptions

Maintaining the players' attention keeps a game moving and leads to memorable moments when everyone's in the zone. Too many interruptions break the flow. Some distractions will always happen, like jokes at the table, but make sure interruptions aren't too frequent. It helps to plan breaks into the game. A 10-minute break is a great time to grab a snack, use the restroom, or look up something on your phone.

Ending a Session

It's best to have a planned end time before your session starts. As your game goes on, keep an eye on the time. When you have around 20 minutes left in your session, start looking for good stopping places. Unless you're finishing up an adventure, try to find a good cliffhanger to end on. This can be just before a fight starts, the moment the heroes find out a new piece of information or enter a new area, or any other point that creates suspense!

Before everybody leaves, have them tally up their XP. They'll need to level up before the next session if it's over 1,000! The characters can also divide treasure and items.

Before your next session, you might need to prepare for the next stage of the adventure. If the adventure concluded this session, talk with the players about whether they want to start a new adventure. If so, start preparing the next adventure for your upcoming session!
Translation:
你通过一系列的团期来完成一场冒险，这些团期通常持续几个小时，包含多次遭遇和一些探索。每个团期都可能与上一个有显著不同。将团期想象成电视剧的一集——它应该包含一些曲折、转折和变化，让玩家对接下来的内容感到兴奋。

规划团期

通常，安排游戏时间的责任落在作为 GM 的你身上，因为你需要在团期之间准备游戏。选择一个每个人都能参加的时代和一个聚会的地点，无论是在厨房桌旁还是在在线空间中。许多游戏都有固定的时间表，例如每周一次、每两周一次或每月一次。（不过，你的第一场游戏可能没那么规律！）你们小组见面的频率越低，你就越需要做好笔记和回顾，以确保每个人步调一致。如果另一位玩家想要记录团期笔记，那也很好，特别是如果他们建立了一个大家可以在线参考的共享文档。

计划一个让大家到达的时代，并尝试设定一个开始游戏的时代。有了这个计划，大家就能更容易地完成叙旧，从而开始游戏。心中有一个结束时代也很重要。典型的游戏团期持续约 4 小时。少于 2 小时通常没有足够的时代来完成太多事情。

开始团期

一旦大家都准备好开始玩了，吸引大家的注意力并掩蔽以下主题。这些主题的大致顺序可以根据你小组的风格或团期的需求进行更改。

• 回顾之前团期中发生的事情（如果这不是第一个团期）。

• 确定英雄们在本团期开始时所处的位置。自上次挑战以来他们一直在休息吗？你上次离开时，他们是在走廊里准备突袭地下城的下一个房间吗？告诉玩家他们的英雄自上个团期以来是否有时代进行休息或恢复。

• 确定目标。重复小组已有的任何目标，然后让玩家发表意见，讨论这些目标是否仍然适用，以及他们在团期期间是否还有其他希望完成的事情。

• 开始冒险！通常你在团期中做的第一件事就是描述英雄周围的环境 and 感官，让他们能够立即做出反应。

运行团期

在团期期间，你负责保持游戏的行动进行、回答问题并做出规则决定。你还需要大致留意时代，以便在对小组最方便的时候结束。

你是那个根据你和其他玩家共享的想象世界来定制所需规则的人。由你来确定世界中什么是真实的，但你在这样做时有帮助！你会参考设定的背景故事、你的准备以及其他玩家提出的建议。你也可以根据你计划的内容即兴调整。你的笔记中可能有一个想法，当玩家做出意想不到的事情时，这个想法就会改变。

你将决定英雄和敌人何时需要尝试检定，以及他们掷骰的结果会发生什么，这在探索中最为常见。在一次遭遇中，玩家通常可以决定自己英雄的回合，而你只需插话说明攻击是否命中，或者环境中的某些事物是否需要英雄尝试一次检定。

聚光灯

在运行游戏时，留意哪位玩家处于聚光灯下。你很容易将注意力集中在最外向的玩家或英雄身上，但你需要与所有玩家进行检定。如果某位玩家已经有一段时代没有贡献了，停下来问问：“你的英雄此时在做什么？”如果玩家不确定，就在场景中添加一个玩家可能感兴趣的细节或 NPC。

分心与干扰

保持玩家的注意力能让游戏持续进行，并在每个人都进入状态时产生令人难忘的时刻。过多的干扰会破坏流畅性。一些分心总是会发生的，比如桌上的笑话，但要确保干扰不要太频繁。在游戏中计划休息时间会有所帮助。10 分钟的休息是拿零食、上厕所或在手机上查找资料的好时代。

结束团期

最好在团期开始前有一个计划好的结束时代。随着游戏的进行，留意时代。当你的团期还剩大约 20 分钟时，开始寻找合适的停止地点。除非你正在完成一场冒险，否则试着找一个好的悬念来结束。这可以是在战斗开始前，英雄们发现新信息的时刻，或者进入一个新区域的时刻，或者任何其他能制造悬念的时点！

在大家离开之前，让他们结算自己的经验值（XP）。如果超过 1,000 点，他们需要在下一个团期之前提升等级！角色们还可以分配宝藏和物品。

在你的下一个团期之前，你可能需要为冒险的下一个阶段做准备。如果冒险在本团期结束，请与玩家讨论他们是否想开始新的冒险。如果是这样，就开始为即将到来的团期准备下一场冒险吧！

Involved Terms: circumstance penalty->环境减值 | Abandoned Storeroom->废弃储藏室 | initiative->先攻 | condition->状态 | flanking->夹击 | treasure->宝藏 | treasure->宝藏 | ability->能力 | success->成功 | toolkit->工具包 | attack->攻击 | attack->攻击 | attack->攻击 | attack->攻击 | damage->伤害 | effect->效果 | weapon->武器 | weapon->武器 | kobold->狗头人 | bonus->加值 | check->检定 | check->检定 | magic->魔法 | skill->技能 | skill->技能 | size->体型 | turn->回合 | turn->回合 | turn->回合
Original:
Ambient Sounds

 Knowledge Base: Ambient Sounds

As your players approach this room, some of them might notice the faint sounds of the Kobolds trying to break into the cage. Foundry VTT's sound engine allows placed sound files to grow louder as tokens grow closer to them. When the kobolds notice the players, you can turn this sound off by switching to the Sounds layer of the scene and right-clicking the sound effect positioned on top of the kobolds.

This room has a small group of kobolds, small reptilian humanoids. Read the following aloud.

This large room looks like it was once a storeroom for a building above. At the far side, you can make out what might have been a cage or cell at some point, but it is now full of crates and barrels. Four lizardlike creatures the size of human children are clustered around the door to the cell, trying to pry it open.

These kobolds are so busy trying to open the cell that they don’t notice the heroes enter, but the moment someone moves within 10 feet of any of the kobolds, they turn around, snarl, and attack— have everyone roll for initiative!

Encounter

@Actor[r9w1n85mp9Ip4QiS]{4 Kobold Warriors}

Flanking

The kobolds here are cunning foes, using tactics and special abilities to gain an edge. When moving, the kobolds try to flank the heroes, standing on opposite sides of a single hero. A hero who is flanked has the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} condition (giving it a –2 circumstance penalty to AC) to all melee attacks made by the flanking kobolds.

You should see this being taken into account by the system if you look at the AC comparisons in the attack result cards!

The kobolds have a special ability called sneak attack that lets them deal extra damage against off-guard heroes. A hero can stop being flanked on their turn by moving away from the kobolds, or if one of the kobolds is reduced to 0 Hit Points.

Experience Points

For defeating the kobolds, award each hero 80 XP.

Locked Storage

@Actor[yFRBdjHLEsCU66sI]{Abandoned Storeroom}

After the fight, the heroes can examine their foes. Some of the kobolds are carrying dried fish stolen from the fishery—clearly they were involved in the thefts, but more fish are missing than can be explained by four kobolds.

The treasure in this room is in the locked steel cell. The heroes can open this cell in either of two ways. They can use a thieves’ toolkit to roll a @Check[type:thievery|dc:15]{Thievery Skill Check} to pick the lock- it opens on a success! You can right-click the door to unlock it and allow your players to open it. Alternatively, they can force open the door, which requires a successful @Check[type:athletics|dc:25]{Athletics Skill Check}.

Inside the cell is a pile of old crates and a few barrels. While most of these contain long-spoiled food and stained cloth, one of them contains a small pile of treasure: 200 sp, a gold ring worth 5 gp, and a beautiful +1 shortsword—a magic weapon! The hero using this weapon increases their bonus to attack rolls by 1!
Translation:
环境音

 知识库：环境音

当你的玩家接近这个房间时，他们中的一些人可能会注意到狗头人试图闯入笼子的微弱声音。Foundry VTT 的声音引擎允许放置的声音文件随着 Token 的靠近而变大。当狗头人注意到玩家时，你可以通过切换到场景的声音图层并右键点击位于狗头人上方的声音 效果 来 关闭 这个声音。

这个房间里有一小群狗头人，这是一种小型的爬行类人生物。大声朗读以下内容。

这个大房间看起来曾经是上方建筑的储藏室。在远端，你可以辨认出曾经可能是笼子或牢房的东西，但现在它装满了板条箱和木桶。四个 体型 像人类小孩一样的蜥蜴状生物聚集在牢房门周围，试图将其撬开。

这些狗头人正忙着尝试打开牢房，以至于没有注意到英雄们进入，但一旦有人移动到任何狗头人 10 英尺范围内，他们就会 转身，发出嘶吼并 攻击——让每个人掷 先攻！

遭遇

@Actor[r9w1n85mp9Ip4QiS]{4个 狗头人 战士}

夹击

这里的狗头人是狡猾的敌人，会利用战术和特殊能力来获得优势。移动时，狗头人会尝试夹击英雄，站在单个英雄的相对两侧。被夹击的英雄在面对 夹击 狗头人的所有近战攻击时，具有 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及} 状态（使其 AC 受到 -2 环境减值）。

如果你查看 攻击 结果卡片中的 AC 对比，你应该会看到系统已经考虑到了这一点！

狗头人有一种名为偷袭的特殊 能力，让他们能对措手不及的英雄造成额外 伤害。英雄可以在他们的 回合 中通过远离狗头人来停止被夹击，或者如果其中一个狗头人的生命值降至 0。

经验值

击败狗头人后，奖励每位英雄 80 XP。

锁住的储藏室

@Actor[yFRBdjHLEsCU66sI]{废弃储藏室}

战斗结束后，英雄们可以检查他们的敌人。一些狗头人带着从渔场偷来的鱼干——显然他们参与了盗窃，但丢失的鱼比四个狗头人所能解释的要多。

这个房间里的 宝藏 在锁着的钢制牢房里。英雄们可以用两种方式之一打开这个牢房。他们可以使用盗贼 工具包 掷一次 @Check[type:thievery|dc:15]{盗法 技能 检定} 来开锁—— 成功 即可打开！你可以右键点击门来解锁它，并允许你的玩家打开它。或者，他们可以强行撞开门，这需要一次成功的 @Check[type:athletics|dc:25]{运动 技能 检定}。

牢房内有一堆旧板条箱和几个木桶。虽然其中大部分装的是早已腐烂的食物 and 污迹斑斑的布料，但其中一个装有一小堆 宝藏：200 sp，一枚价值 5 gp 的金戒指，以及一把精美的 +1 短剑——一件 魔法 武器！使用此 武器 的英雄将其 攻击 检定的 加值 增加 1！

Involved Terms: Menace Under Otari->奥塔里地下的威胁 | adventure->冒险 | character->角色 | encounter->遭遇 | encounter->遭遇 | currency->现金 | player->玩家
Original:
To keep everything organized, the Journals contained on the Journal Entry Sidebar tab on the right were built with a standardized approach to 'box text' to make it easier to learn. The following are examples of the codified styles used throughout:

This is a Narrative box. Within the Menace Under Otari adventure, text which looks like this is usually intended to be read aloud to the players by the Gamemaster.

Foundry VTT Advice

One of the most commonly used call-outs, a box which looks like this one will give you instructions specific to using features of Foundry VTT.

Encounters

A box which looks like this one contains references to creatures or threats that are dangerous to the player characters, as well as tactics and advice for how to facilitate the encounter. Usually, the top of the box will contain a dynamic link to relevant Actor sheets so that you can quickly reference character stats or make rolls.

Treasure

Treasure text boxes contain a summary of special items and goods to reward your players for their successes, and usually follow an encounter. You will find that most of these link to a special type of Actor Sheet called a "Loot Sheet" which contains all the special items and currency to be shared.
Translation:
为了保持条理清晰，右侧“日志条目”侧边栏标签页中的日志采用了标准化的“框文”方法构建，以便于学习。以下是全文中使用的规范化样式示例：

这是一个叙述框。在 奥塔里地下的威胁 冒险 中，像这样的文本通常旨在由游戏主持人朗读给玩家听。

Foundry VTT 建议

这是最常用的标注之一，像这样的框会为你提供有关使用 Foundry VTT 功能的具体说明。

遭遇

像这样的框包含对 玩家 角色有危险的生物或威胁的引用，以及如何引导 遭遇 的战术和建议。通常，框的顶部会包含指向相关角色表 (Actor sheets) 的动态链接，以便你可以快速查阅 角色 属性或进行掷骰。

宝藏

宝藏文本框包含特殊物品和货物的摘要，用以奖励玩家的成功，通常紧随 遭遇 之后。你会发现其中大多数都链接到一种称为“战利品表 (Loot Sheet)”的特殊角色表 (Actor Sheet)，其中包含所有要分享的特殊物品和 现金。

JSON Path: root.entries.Menace Under Otari.journals.Menace Under Otari.pages.Mermaid Fountain.text
Involved Terms: Mermaid Fountain->美人鱼喷泉 | Mermaid Fountain->美人鱼喷泉 | exploration->探索 | initiative->先攻 | initiative->先攻 | initiative->先攻 | Perception->察觉 | Perception->察觉 | stat block->数据表 | currency->现金 | Hardness->硬度 | actions->动作 | monster->怪物 | success->成功 | trigger->触发 | setting->设定 | damage->伤害 | player->玩家 | target->目标 | check->检定 | check->检定 | coins->钱币 | coins->钱币 | coins->钱币 | skill->技能 | area->区域 | turn->回合 | turn->回合 | time->时代
Original:
This chamber contains a devious trap. When the heroes enter this area, read the following aloud.

While much of this rectangular chamber is in ruins, the center contains a fountain of pristine water with something glittering at the bottom. In the middle of the fountain is a marble statue of a mermaid, her lips pursed as if she were about to blow a kiss, or maybe whistle. Each corner of the pool has some sort of mechanism embedded in the stones, but the one in the southwest corner appears to be smashed.

The mermaid statue in the center of the room is the center of a devious trap. When the heroes enter the room, ask each player to roll a @Check[type:perception|dc:20]{Perception Check}. Take note of these results, because you'll also use them to determine the heroes' initiative.

If anyone's total is 20 or higher, they notice the trap before setting it off. If not, the heroes don't notice anything unusual. They can act normally- but if anyone steps on any of the tiles adjacent to the pool, the trap goes off!

Encounter

@Actor[v51J7K27abdDyLgJ]{Mermaid Fountain}

This trap is complex, which means it works like a monster. If the heroes trigger the trap, use the Perception results from before to determine their initiative. You can do this by activating the combat tracker and clicking on the crossed swords icon beside the roll in chat. The fountain rolls Stealth for its initiative.

On its turn, the statue in the middle of the fountain spins around, shooting a stream of high-pressure water from its mouth. The exact effects are different each round and target random parts of the room. The trap's Routine entry describes how this works.

Overcoming the Trap

The heroes can overcome this trap in a variety of ways. If someone notices it before it goes off and everyone avoids the squares adjacent to the fountain, they can safely bypass the trap.

Once the trap goes off, the heroes can try to disable the control mechanisms located at each corner of the pool. If any of these stones are still active, the trap continues to act on its turn, but fortunately for the heroes, the mechanism in the southwest corner has already been destroyed (leaving only those in the other three corners to deactivate). To deactivate a mechanism, a hero must stand in an adjacent square and spend 2 actions to attempt a @Check[type:thievery|dc:20]{Thievery Skill Check}. On a success, that mechanism is disabled.

The heroes can also physically destroy the three remaining mechanisms by attacking them individually (using the AC and Hit Points in the trap's stat block). The fountain, being made of stone, has Hardness. Each time a hero hits a mechanism, subtract this number from the damage roll before reducing the mechanism’s Hit Points.

Once there are no functioning mechanisms left, whether the heroes have disabled or destroyed them, the trap stops working, and the heroes can continue their exploration.

Experience Points

If they heroes bypass the fountain, disable it, or destroy it, award each hero 80 XP.

Treasure

@Actor[xhyzSiXfoAxud376]{Mermaid Fountain}

Once the trap is deactivated, a hero can easily climb into the fountain and get the coins. The water is only 1 foot deep, and while it's very cold, it's not dangerous. Inside the fountain are 28 cp, 8 sp, and 2 gp.

Often, when players find a stash of assorted coins, they'll want to split them equally. You can use the "distribute coins" button on the loot sheet to share the currency between your heroes without needing to do any calculations yourself!
Translation:
这个房间包含一个阴险的陷阱。当英雄们进入该区域时，大声朗读以下内容。

虽然这个长方形房间的大部分已成废墟，但中心有一座流淌着纯净泉水的喷泉，底部有什么东西在闪闪发光。喷泉中央是一尊大理石的美人鱼雕像，她噘着嘴，仿佛正要送出一个飞吻，又或者是在吹口哨。水池的每个角落都有某种镶嵌在石头里的机械装置，但西南角的那个似乎已经被砸坏了。

房间中央的美人鱼雕像是这个阴险陷阱的核心。当英雄们进入房间时，要求每个玩家掷一次@Check[type:perception|dc:20]{察觉 检定}。记下这些结果，因为你还将使用它们来确定英雄们的先攻。

如果任何人的总值达到20或更高，他们就会在触发陷阱前发现它。如果没有，英雄们就不会注意到任何异常。他们可以正常行动——但如果有人踩到水池相邻的任何地砖上，陷阱就会触发！

遭遇 Encounter

@Actor[v51J7K27abdDyLgJ]{美人鱼喷泉}

这个陷阱是复杂陷阱，这意味着它的运作方式类似于怪物。如果英雄们触发了陷阱，使用之前的察觉结果来确定他们的先攻。你可以通过激活战斗追踪器并点击聊天框中检定结果旁边的交叉剑图标来完成此操作。喷泉使用隐秘检定来掷其先攻。

在它的回合中，喷泉中央的雕像会旋转，从口中喷出一股高压水流。每一轮的具体效果都不同，并且会目标房间内的随机区域。陷阱的“常规（Routine）”条目描述了其运作方式。

克服陷阱 Overcoming the Trap

英雄们可以通过多种方式克服这个陷阱。如果有人在陷阱触发前发现了它，并且所有人都避开与喷泉相邻的方格，他们就可以安全地绕过陷阱。

一旦陷阱触发，英雄们可以尝试解除位于水池每个角落的控制机构。如果这些石块中仍有任何一个处于激活状态，陷阱就会继续在其回合行动，但对英雄们来说幸运的是，西南角的机构已经被摧毁了（只剩下其他三个角落的机构需要停用）。要停用一个机构，英雄必须站在相邻的方格内，并花费2个动作尝试一次@Check[type:thievery|dc:20]{盗法 技能 检定}。成功时，该机构被停用。

英雄们也可以通过分别攻击剩下的三个机构来物理摧毁它们（使用陷阱数据表中的AC和生命值）。喷泉是由石头制成的，具有硬度。每次英雄击中机构时，在减少机构的生命值之前，从伤害掷骰中减去这个数值。

一旦没有剩余的功能性机构，无论英雄们是停用了还是摧毁了它们，陷阱都会停止运作，英雄们可以继续他们的探索。

经验值 Experience Points

如果英雄们绕过、停用或摧毁了喷泉，奖励每位英雄80 XP。

宝藏 Treasure

@Actor[xhyzSiXfoAxud376]{美人鱼喷泉}

一旦陷阱被停用，英雄可以轻松爬进喷泉并拿走钱币。水只有1英尺深，虽然很冷，但并不危险。喷泉内有28 cp、8 sp和2 gp。

通常，当玩家发现一堆杂乱的钱币时，他们会想平分。你可以使用战利品表上的“分发钱币”按钮来在英雄之间分享现金，而无需自己进行任何计算！

JSON Path: root.entries.Menace Under Otari.journals.Creating Your Hero.pages.Character Creation.text
Involved Terms: Pathfinder Beginner Box->Pathfinder新手包 | Pathfinder Society->开拓者协会 | Pathfinder Society->开拓者协会 | Pathfinder Society->开拓者协会 | character creation->创建角色 | Menace Under Otari->奥塔里地下的威胁 | character sheet->角色卡 | character sheet->角色卡 | character sheet->角色卡 | adventure->冒险 | adventure->冒险 | character->角色 | character->角色 | character->角色 | actions->动作 | level->等级 | stage->阶段
Original:
Are you ready to dive into adventure? The first thing you need to do is create your hero! It's up to you to imagine your hero's past experiences, personality, and worldview- this will set the stage for your roleplay during the game.

Character Creation

 PF2E System Wiki: Making a PC @UUID[JournalEntry.qFSLpCM2cpRQWCR2.JournalEntryPage.WpWULbveo4SMmMj5]{Pathfinder Society}

Character Sheets

The first step is getting your hands on your character sheet. If you're making new characters, your GM can create new sheets for you by clicking "Create Actor" on the actors tab of the sidebar. They'll need to assign the actor to you as well, which can be done by right-clicking on it and giving you the "Owner" permission under "Configure Permissions".

If you could use some guidance on learning to read and use the Pathfinder Second Edition system's character sheets, you can use the system's wiki linked above to familiarise yourself with the fields and tabs it has to offer, as well as some specific advice for playing certain classes.

Useful Tools

During character creation, or later on as you level up your hero, you're going to be adding actions, feats, items, spells, and other features to your character sheet. The system includes all of this data for you- you need only apply it to your character!

On the "compendiums" tab of your sidebar, at the bottom, there is a button labelled "Compendium Browser". When clicked, this opens an interface which allows you to search and filter through all of the rules content included in the system. You can use this to quickly find the features you'd like to choose, and then drag them from this window onto your character sheet. It's as simple as that!

Character Creation Rules

In some places, the rules or character options presented in the Pathfinder Beginner Box PDF may differ from those this used in these journal pages or in the PF2E system. This is because the Beginner Box presents a simplified and streamlined set of rules in the interest of making the system a little easier to learn.

Because a virtual tabletop handles a lot of the minutia and complexity that comes from learning the mechanics of a new game system, we've chosen to stick to the full rules as outlined in the Pathfinder Second Edition Core Rulebook.

However, you're welcome to refer back to the Beginner Box PDF if you would like to play with those rules instead. If you aren't sure where you should be looking, make sure that you ask your GM. Once you have the rules in hand, you can use the steps here to guide your process!

Pathfinder Society

If you're planning on running the adventure Menace Under Otari for Pathfinder Society organised play, it becomes especially important that you take into account which version of the rules you use to create your characters. If you haven't already, consult the @UUID[JournalEntry.qFSLpCM2cpRQWCR2.JournalEntryPage.WpWULbveo4SMmMj5]{Pathfinder Society} journal page to find out more.
Translation:
你准备好投身于冒险了吗？你首先需要做的就是创建你的英雄！由你来想象你英雄的过往经历、性格和世界观——这将为你游戏期间的角色扮演搭建阶段。

角色创建

 PF2E系统维基：创建角色 @UUID[JournalEntry.qFSLpCM2cpRQWCR2.JournalEntryPage.WpWULbveo4SMmMj5]{开拓者协会}

角色卡

第一步是拿到你的角色卡。如果你要创建新角色，你的GM可以通过点击侧边栏角色（actors）标签页上的“创建角色（Create Actor）”来为你创建新的角色卡。他们还需要将该角色分配给你，这可以通过右键点击它并在“配置权限（Configure Permissions）”下给予你“所有者（Owner）”权限来完成。

如果你需要一些关于学习阅读和使用Pathfinder第二版系统的角色卡的指导，你可以使用上面链接的系统维基来熟悉它提供的字段和标签页，以及一些关于游玩特定职业的具体建议。

实用工具

在创建角色期间，或者稍后当你为英雄提升等级时，你将向你的角色卡添加动作、专长、物品、法术和其他特征。系统已经为你包含了所有这些数据——你只需要将它们应用到你的角色上！

在侧边栏的“典籍（compendiums）”标签页底部，有一个名为“典籍浏览器（Compendium Browser）”的按钮。点击后，会打开一个界面，允许你搜索和筛选系统中包含的所有规则内容。你可以使用它快速找到你想要选择的特征，然后将它们从该窗口拖到你的角色卡上。就这么简单！

角色创建规则

在某些地方，Pathfinder新手包 PDF中呈现的规则或角色选项可能与这些日志页面或PF2E系统中使用的有所不同。这是因为新手包为了让系统更容易学习，提供了一套简化且流线化的规则。

由于虚拟桌面处理了学习新游戏系统机制时带来的许多琐碎和复杂之处，我们选择坚持使用《Pathfinder第二版核心规则书》中概述的完整规则。

但是，如果你想使用那些规则进行游戏，欢迎参考新手包PDF。如果你不确定该看哪里，请务必询问你的GM。一旦你掌握了规则，就可以使用这里的步骤来指导你的流程！

开拓者协会

如果你计划为开拓者协会组织化游戏运行冒险奥塔里地下的威胁，那么考虑到你使用哪个版本的规则来创建角色就变得尤为重要。如果你还没有看过，请查阅 @UUID[JournalEntry.qFSLpCM2cpRQWCR2.JournalEntryPage.WpWULbveo4SMmMj5]{开拓者协会} 日志页面以了解更多信息。

Original:
Dungeons are rife with devious traps meant to protect the treasures within, ranging from devices that shoot darts to those that drop heavy blocks or expose hidden pit traps.

While hazards are often encountered during @UUID[.zvGaSL2IpbvcyeUQ]{Exploration}, they can also be a complication during a @UUID[.ZFjG6Np42VRz5hFu#combat-encounters]{Combat Encounter} with creatures, or even be the subject of an entire encounter of their own. To learn more about how to use hazards in your game, keep reading!

Running Hazards

Detecting a Hazard

Every hazard has a trigger of some kind, like a trip wire or a pressure plate. When characters approach a hazard, they have a chance of finding the mechanism before triggering the hazard. During exploration, determine whether the party detects a hazard when the heroes first enter the area in which it appears. Only someone actively searching (using the Search activity while exploring or the Seek action in an encounter) has a chance to notice them. Anyone who succeeds becomes aware of the hazard, and you can describe what they notice.

Triggering a Hazard

If the group fails to detect a hazard and the hazard’s trigger depends on a standard part of traveling (such as stepping on a floor plate), the hazard’s reaction occurs. Hazards that would be triggered only when someone directly manipulates the environment—by opening a door, for example—use their reactions only if a hero explicitly takes that action.

Disabling a Hazard

The most versatile method for deactivating traps is the Disable a Device action of the Thievery skill. The DC is listed in the hazard’s stat block. As noted in skills, a creature must be trained in Thievery to use the Disable a Device action. Fully disarming some traps requires multiple successful Disable a Device actions. For example, disabling scythe blades requires a successful check on each of two blades. A critical failure on any roll to disable a hazard triggers it.

A character must first detect a hazard (or have it pointed out to them) to try to deactivate it. They can attempt to deactivate a hazard whether or not it has already been triggered, though most hazards no longer pose a danger once their reactions have occurred.

Damaging a Hazard

Damaging a trap works like damaging a shield: the trap reduces the damage it takes by its Hardness. If a hazard’s Hit Points are reduced to its Broken Threshold (BT) or lower, the hazard becomes broken and can no longer be activated. If it’s reduced to 0 HP, it’s destroyed and can’t be repaired. Usually, the trap is triggered when attacked, though it isn’t triggered if it’s destroyed in one hit because there’s not enough left to harm anyone! If it’s broken in one hit but not destroyed, you decide whether it triggers based on the type of trap.

Hazards’ AC, saving throws, Hardness, HP, and BT are listed in their stat blocks. A hazard that doesn’t list one of these statistics can’t be affected by anything targeting that statistic. For example, a hazard that has HP but no BT can’t be broken, but it can still be destroyed. Hazards can be targeted only by things that specifically say they can target objects. Certain abilities like bleed damage, poison, mental effects, and the sickened condition don’t work against a hazard, nor do any other effects that wouldn’t reasonably work on an object.

Hazard Experience

Characters gain XP for overcoming a hazard, whether they disable it, avoid it, or simply endure its attacks. If they trigger the same hazard later on, they don’t gain XP for the hazard again. The XP a hazard gives depends on the party’s level, as shown below. For example, a 0-level hazard faced by a 1st-level party is worth 6 XP because level 0 is the party’s level -1.

Level

Translation:
地城中充斥着狡诈的陷阱，旨在保护其中的宝藏，其种类从发射飞镖的装置到落下重石或显露隐藏坑洞陷阱的装置不等。

虽然危害通常在 @UUID[.zvGaSL2IpbvcyeUQ]{探索} 期间遇到，但它们也可能是在与生物进行的 @UUID[.ZFjG6Np42VRz5hFu#combat-encounters]{战斗遭遇} 中的一种变数，甚至其本身就是一个完整的 遭遇。想要了解更多关于如何在游戏中使用危害的信息，请继续阅读！

运行危害

检测危害

每种 危害 都有某种 触发，例如绊线或压力板。当角色接近 危害 时，他们有机会在触发 危害 之前发现其机制。在 探索 期间，当英雄们首次进入 危害 出现的 区域 时，判定队伍是否检测到了该 危害。只有正在积极搜索的人（在探索时使用搜索 行动，或在 遭遇 中使用寻找行动）才有机会注意到它们。任何成功的人都会察觉到该 危害，你可以描述他们注意到了什么。

触发危害

如果小队未能检测到 危害，且该 危害 的 触发 取决于旅行中的标准部分（例如踩到地板上的踏板），则该 危害 的反应发生。只有当有人直接操纵 环境（例如通过开门）时才会触发的 危害，仅在英雄明确采取该行动时才会使用其反应。

禁用危害

停用陷阱最通用的方法是使用贼活 技能 的禁用装置行动。DC 列在 危害 的 数据表 中。正如技能中所述，生物 必须在贼活上达到受训，才能使用禁用装置行动。完全解除某些陷阱需要多次成功的禁用装置 动作。例如，禁用大镰刀刀刃需要对两把刀刃中的每一把都进行一次成功的 检定。任何禁用 危害 的投骰若出现 大成功或大失败失败，都会触发它。

角色 必须首先检测到 危害（或由他人指出），才能尝试停用它。无论 危害 是否已被触发，他们都可以尝试停用它，尽管大多数危害在反应发生后就不再构成危险。

伤害危害

伤害陷阱的工作方式类似于伤害盾牌：陷阱会根据其 硬度 减免所受的 伤害。如果 危害 的生命值降低到其破损阈值（BT）或更低，该 危害 就会变得破损，且无法再被激活。如果它被降低到 0 HP，它就会被摧毁且无法修复。通常，陷阱在受到攻击时会被触发，但如果它被一击摧毁，则不会触发，因为已经没有剩余部分可以伤害任何人了！如果它被一击导致破损但未被摧毁，则由你根据陷阱的类型决定它是否触发。

危害 的 AC、豁免投骰、硬度、HP 和 BT 都列在它们的数据表中。未列出其中某项统计数据的 危害，不受任何针对该统计数据的效果影响。例如，具有 HP 但没有 BT 的 危害 不能被破损，但仍可以被摧毁。危害 只能被明确说明可以 目标 物品的事物作为目标。某些能力如流血 伤害、毒素、心灵效果和生病 状态 对 危害 无效，其他任何无法合理作用于 物体 的效果也同样无效。

危害经验值

角色通过克服 危害 获得经验值，无论他们是停用了它、避开了它，还是仅仅承受了它的攻击。如果他们稍后再次 触发 同一个 危害，他们不会再次获得该 危害 的经验值。危害 提供的经验值取决于队伍的 等级，如下所示。例如，1 级队伍面对的 0-等级 危害 价值 6 XP，因为 等级 0 是队伍的 等级 -1。
